translations.text: گفتند: «آيا به سوى ما آمده‌اى تا ما را از شيوه‌اى كه پدرانمان را بر آن يافته‌ايم بازگردانى، و بزرگى در اين سرزمين براى شما دو تن باشد؟ ما به شما دو تن ايمان نداريم.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پاسخ دادند که آیا تو آمده‌ای که ما را از عقاید و آدابی که پدران خود را بر آن یافته‌ایم بازگردانی تا خود و برادرت هارون در زمین سلطنت یابید و بر ما حکمفرما شوید؟ ما هرگز به شما ایمان نخواهیم آورد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: گفتند: (ای موسی!) آیا به پیش ما آمده‌ای تا ما را از (عقائد و تقالید و) چیزهائی منصرف گردانی که پدران و نیاکان خود را بر آن دیده و یافته‌ایم، و می‌خواهید بزرگی (و ریاست) در زمین برای شما دو نفر باشد؟ ما به هیچ وجه به شما ایمان نمی‌آوریم. [[«لِتَلْفِتَنَا»: تا ما را منصرف کنی. «الْکِبْرِیَآءُ»: عظمت. سَیطره. شاهی و سَروری.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گفتند آیا به سراغ ما آمده‌ای که ما را از شیوه‌ای که پدرانمان را بر آن یافته بودیم، بازداری، و در این سرزمین ریاست از شما دو تن باشد؟ و ما [سخن‌] شما را باور نداریم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: گفتند: «آیا آمده‌ای که ما را، از آنچه پدرانمان را بر آن یافتیم، منصرف سازی؛ و بزرگی (و ریاست) در روی زمین، از آن شما دو تن باشد؟! ما (هرگز) به شما ایمان نمی‌آوریم!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفتند آیا آمدی ما را تا برگردانی ما را از آنچه یافتیم بر آن پدران خویش را و باشد برای شما بزرگواری در زمین و نیستیم ما برای شما باورکنندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفتند: آيا نزد ما آمده‌اى تا ما را از آنچه پدرانمان را بر آن يافته‌ايم بگردانى و بزرگى در اين سرزمين شما دو تن را باشد؟ ما هرگز به شما ايمان نمى آوريم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفتند: «آیا سوی ما آمده‌ای تا ما را از شیوه‌ای که پدرانمان را بر آن یافته‌ایم رویگردان کنی و بزرگواری در این سرزمین تنها برای شما دو تن باشد؟ در حالی که ما برای شما دو تن ایمان (و اطمینان) آورنده نیستیم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "Have you come," said they, "to turn us back from what we found our ancestors doing, so that the two of you may attain supremacy in the land? We shall not believe in what you say.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They said, “Have you two come to us to revert us from what we found our fathers upon, and that the leadership in the land may only be for you two? And we shall never believe in you both.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They said, 'Art thou come to us to turn us from that we found our fathers practising, and that the domination in the land might belong to you two? We do not believe you.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They said: art thou come unto us to turn us aside from that faith whereon We found our fathers, and that the greatness in the land shall be unto you twain! And for the sake of you twain we are not going to be believers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They said: "Have you come to us to turn us away from that (Faith) we found our fathers following, - and that you two may have greatness in the land? We are not going to believe you two!"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They said, “Did you come to us to divert us from what we found our ancestors following, and so that you become prominent in the land? We will never believe in you.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They replied: 'Have you come to turn us away from the way of our forefathers that the two of you might become supreme in the land? We shall never accept what the two of you say.'

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They said: "Have you come to us to turn us away from that we found our fathers following, and that you two may have greatness in the land We are not going to believe you two!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: They said: Hast thou come unto us to pervert us from that (faith) in which we found our fathers, and that you two may own the place of greatness in the land? We will not believe you two.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They said, ‘Have you come to us to turn us away from what we found our fathers following, so that supremacy may be yours in the land? We will not believe in the two of you.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They said: 'Have you come to turn us away from that which we found our fathers practicing (in order that) the domination of the land might belong to you two? We do not believe you'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: They said, "Have you come to us to turn us away from that upon which we found our fathers and so that you two may have grandeur in the land? And we are not believers in you."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They asked Moses, "Have you come to turn us away from the faith of our fathers and to make yourselves the rulers in the land? We shall never accept your faith."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: They said: Have you come to us to turn us away from what we found our fathers upon, and (that) greatness in the land should be for you two? And we are not going to believe in you.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qaloo ajitana litalfitana AAamma wajadna AAalayhi abaana watakoona lakuma alkibriyao fee alardi wama nahnu lakuma bimumineena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They said, "Have you come to turn us away from what we found our forefathers following, so that the two of you might become supreme in this land? We will never believe in you."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They said: "Hast thou come to us to turn us away from the ways we found our fathers following,- in order that thou and thy brother may have greatness in the land? But not we shall believe in you!"

verses.text: وَ قَالَ‌ فِرْعَوْنُ‌ ائْتُونِي‌ بِکُلِ‌ سَاحِرٍ عَلِيمٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و فرعون گفت: [برای درهم کوبیدن این دو نفر] هر جادوگر دانا و زبردستی را نزد من آورید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: فرعون گفت: همه جادوگران دانا را نزد من بياوريد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و فرعون گفت: همه جادوگران دانا و ماهر را پيش من آريد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و فرعون گفت: «هر جادوگر دانايى را پيش من آوريد.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و فرعون (به اتباعش) گفت: هر کجا ساحری ماهر و داناست همه را نزد من حاضر کنید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: فرعون گفت: همه‌ی جادوگران ماهر و زبردست را به پیش من بیاورید (تا کار این دو جادوگر را بسازیم). [[«عَلِیمٍ»: آگاه و زبردست.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و فرعون گفت همه جادوگران دانا را به نزد من آورید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: فرعون گفت: «(بروید و) هر جادوگر (و ساحر) دانایی را نزد من آورید!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و گفت فرعون بیارید مرا به هر جادوگری دانشمند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و فرعون گفت: هر جادوگر دانا و كارآزموده را نزد من آوريد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و فرعون (به کارگردانانش) گفت: «هر جادوگر دانایی را پیش من آورید.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "Bring the cleverest magicians to me," said the Pharaoh.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And Firaun said, “Bring every expert magician to me.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Pharaoh said, 'Bring me every cunning sorcerer.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And Firawn said: bring unto me every magician knowing.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And Fir'aun (Pharaoh) said: "Bring to me every well-versed sorcerer."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Pharaoh said, “Bring me every experienced sorcerer.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And Pharaoh said (to his) men: 'Bring every skilled sorcerer to me.'

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And Fir`awn said: "Bring me every well-versed sorcerer."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And Pharaoh said: Bring every cunning wizard unto me.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Pharaoh said, ‘Bring me every expert magician.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: (Then) Pharaoh said: 'Bring every skilled sorcerer'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And Pharaoh said, "Bring to me every learned magician."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The Pharaoh ordered every skillful magician to come into his presence.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And Firon said: Bring to me every skillful magician.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waqala firAAawnu itoonee bikulli sahirin AAaleemin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Then Pharaoh said, "Bring me every skilled magician!"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Said Pharaoh: "Bring me every sorcerer well versed."

verses.text: فَلَمَّا جَاءَ السَّحَرَةُ قَالَ‌ لَهُمْ‌ مُوسَى‌ أَلْقُوا مَا أَنْتُمْ‌ مُلْقُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: چون جادوگران آمدند، موسی به آنان گفت: آنچه را بر افکندن آن مصمم هستید، بیفکنید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چون جادوگران آمدند، موسى گفت: بيفكنيد هر چه را كه بايد بيفكنيد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و چون جادوگران آمدند، موسى به آنها گفت: آنچه قرار است بيفكنيد، بيفكنيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و چون جادوگران آمدند، موسى به آنان گفت: «آنچه را مى‌اندازيد بيندازيد.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آن گاه که ساحران همه حاضر شدند موسی به ساحران گفت که شما اول بساط سحر خود را بیندازید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هنگامی که جادوگران گرد آمدند، موسی بدیشان گفت: (هرچه از فنون سحر می‌دانید به کار بندید و) آنچه می‌توانید بیندازید و بیفکنید (تا ببینیم). [[«السَّحَرَة»: جادوگران. «مُلْقُونَ»: افکنندگان. اندازندگان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و چون جادوگران فرا آمدند، موسی به آنان گفت چیزی را که اندازنده‌اش هستید، بیندازید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هنگامی که ساحران (به میدان مبارزه) آمدند، موسی به آنها گفت: «آنچه (از وسایل سحر) را می‌توانید بیفکنید، بیفکنید!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس گاهی که آمدند جادوگران گفت بدیشان موسی بیفکنید آنچه را هستید افکنندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: چون جادوگران بيامدند موسى به آنها گفت: آنچه خواهيد افكند بيفكنيد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس چون جادوگران آمدند، موسی به آنان گفت: «آنچه را شما اندازنده‌اید بیندازید.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So when the magicians arrived, Moses said to them: "Cast whatever (spell) you have to cast."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So when the magicians came, Moosa said to them, “Cast whatever you intend to cast.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then, when the sorcerers came, Moses said to them, 'Cast you down what you will cast.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then when the magicians were come, Musa said unto them: cast down that which ye are going to cast down.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And when the sorcerers came, Musa (Moses) said to them: "Cast down what you want to cast!"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And when the sorcerers came, Moses said to them, “Throw whatever you have to throw.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And when the sorcerers came Moses said to them: 'Cast whatever you wish to cast.'

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And when the sorcerers came, Musa said to them: "Cast down what you want to cast!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And when the wizards came, Moses said unto them: Cast your cast!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So when the magicians came, Moses said to them, ‘Throw down what you have to throw.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: When the sorcerers came, Moses said to them: 'Cast down what you will cast'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So when the magicians came, Moses said to them, "Throw down whatever you will throw."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: When all the magicians were brought to his court, Moses asked them to cast down what they wanted to.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And when the magicians came, Musa said to them: Cast down what you have to cast.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Falamma jaa alssaharatu qala lahum moosa alqoo ma antum mulqoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: When the magicians came, Moses said to them, "Cast down whatever you are going to cast down."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: When the sorcerers came, Moses said to them: "Throw ye what ye (wish) to throw!"

verses.text: فَلَمَّا أَلْقَوْا قَالَ‌ مُوسَى‌ مَا جِئْتُمْ‌ بِهِ‌ السِّحْرُ إِنَ‌ اللَّهَ‌ سَيُبْطِلُهُ‌ إِنَ‌ اللَّهَ‌ لاَ يُصْلِحُ‌ عَمَلَ‌ الْمُفْسِدِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس هنگامی که افکندند، موسی گفت: آنچه را در این صحنه آوردید، جادوست؛ مسلماً خدا آن را به زودی باطل می کند، قطعاً خدا، کار مفسدان را [که برای تقویت طاغیان انجام می دهند] به سامان نمی آورد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چون بيفكندند، موسى گفت: آنچه شما آورده‌ايد جادوست و خدا آن را باطل خواهد ساخت، زيرا خدا كار مفسدان را به صلاح نمى‌آورد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: چون بيفكندند، موسى گفت: آنچه آورده‌ايد جادوست و خدا به زودى باطلش مى‌كند كه خدا كار مفسدان را به سامان نمى‌رساند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس چون افكندند، موسى گفت: «آنچه را شما به ميان آورديد سحر است. به زودى خدا آن را باطل خواهد كرد. آرى، خدا كار مفسدان را تأييد نمى‌كند.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آن‌گاه که ساحران بساط جادو انداختند، موسی گفت: خدا البته سحر شما را باطل خواهد کرد، که خدا هرگز عمل مفسدان را اصلاح نکند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هنگامی که (ریسمانها و عصاهای خود را) انداختند، موسی گفت: آنچه ارائه دادید واقعاً جادو است. قطعاً خداوند آن را پوچ و نابود خواهد کرد و (جای شگفت نیست، چرا که) خداوند کار تبهکاران را (بقاء و دوام نمی‌بخشد و) شایسته و سودمند نمی‌گرداند. [[«أَلْقَوْا»: انداختند. مراد انداختن ریسمانها و عصاهای جادوگری است (نگا: شعراء / 44). «لا یُصْلِحُ»: شایسته ماندن نمی‌سازد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و چون درانداختند، موسی گفت آنچه به میان آورده‌اید، جادوست، که خداوند به زودی باطلش می‌کند، چرا که خداوند عمل مفسدان را تایید نمی‌کند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هنگامی که افکندند، موسی گفت: «آنچه شما آوردید، سحر است؛ که خداوند بزودی آن را باطل می‌کند؛ چرا که خداوند (هرگز) عمل مفسدان را اصلاح نمی‌کند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: سپس هنگامی که افکندند گفت موسی آنچه آوردید جادو است و خدا زود است تباه سازدش همانا خدا راست نیارد کردار تبهکاران را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس چون [طنابها و چوبها] بيفكندند، موسى گفت: آنچه آورديد همه جادوست، همانا خداوند بزودى آن را باطل مى‌كند، كه خدا عمل تباهكاران را به سامان نمى‌آرد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس چون افکندند، موسی گفت: «آنچه را شما (به میان) آوردید سحر است. زودا (که) خدا آن را همواره باطل کند. بی‌گمان خدا کار مفسدان را اصلاح نمی‌کند.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When they had cast (their spell) Moses said: "What you have cast is only a charm which God will surely nullify. God does not verily render the deeds of evil-doers righteous.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Therefore when they had cast, Moosa said, “This what you have brought, is magic; Allah will now make it void; indeed Allah does not make the works of the mischievous successful.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then, when they had cast, Moses said, 'What you have brought is sorcery; God will assuredly bring it to naught. God sets not right the work of those who do corruption.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then when they had cast down, Musa said: that which ye have brought is magic, verily Allah will soon make it vain; verily Allah setteth not right the work of the corrupters.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then when they had cast down, Musa (Moses) said: "What you have brought is sorcery, Allah will surely make it of no effect. Verily, Allah does not set right the work of Al-Mufsidun (the evil-doers, corrupts, etc.).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And when they threw, Moses said, “What you produced is sorcery, and God will make it fail. God does not foster the efforts of the corrupt.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Then when they had cast (their staffs), Moses said: 'What you have produced is sheer sorcery. Allah will certainly reduce it to naught. Surely Allah does not set right the work of the mischief-makers.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then when they had cast down, Musa said: "What you have brought is sorcery, Allah will surely make it of no effect. Verily, Allah does not set right the work of the evildoers.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And when they had cast, Moses said: That which ye have brought is magic. Lo! Allah will make it vain. Lo! Allah upholdeth not the work of mischief-makers.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So when they threw down [their sticks and ropes], Moses said, ‘What you have produced is magic. Indeed Allah will bring it to naught presently. Indeed Allah does not foster the efforts of those who cause corruption.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And when they had cast, Moses said: 'What you have brought is sorcery. Surely, Allah will render it as nothing. Allah does not put right the work of the corrupt'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And when they had thrown, Moses said, "What you have brought is [only] magic. Indeed, Allah will expose its worthlessness. Indeed, Allah does not amend the work of corrupters.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: When the magicians had thrown theirs, Moses said, "What you have performed is magic. God will certainly prove it to be false; He will not make the deeds of the corrupt people righteous.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So when they cast down, Musa said to them: What you have brought is deception; surely Allah will make it naught; surely Allah does not make the work of mischief-makers to thrive.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Falamma alqaw qala moosa ma jitum bihi alssihru inna Allaha sayubtiluhu inna Allaha la yuslihu AAamala almufsideena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: And when they had done so, Moses said, "What you have wrought is mere sorcery. Surely, God will bring it to nothing. Truly, God does not support the work of mischief-makers;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: When they had had their throw, Moses said: "What ye have brought is sorcery: Allah will surely make it of no effect: for Allah prospereth not the work of those who make mischief.

verses.text: وَ يُحِقُ‌ اللَّهُ‌ الْحَقَ‌ بِکَلِمَاتِهِ‌ وَ لَوْ کَرِهَ‌ الْمُجْرِمُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و خدا حق را با دلایل و معجزاتش ثابت و پابرجا می کند، گرچه گنهکاران خوش نداشته باشند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و خداوند با سخنان خود حق را به اثبات مى‌رساند، اگر چه مجرمان را ناخوش آيد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و خدا با كلمات خويش حق را تثبيت مى‌كند، هر چند مجرمان خوش نداشته باشند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و خدا با كلمات خود، حق را ثابت مى‌گرداند، هر چند بزهكاران را خوش نيايد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و خدا به (آیات و) کلمات خود حق را تا ابد پایدار گرداند هر چند بدکاران عالم راضی نباشند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: خداوند با سخنان خود (که بر انبیاء نازل می‌کند) حق را پایدار و ماندگار می‌گرداند، هرچند که گناهکاران و بزهکاران نپسندند. [[«یُحِقُّ»: نمایان و ثابت می‌گرداند (نگا: انفال / 7 و 8). «بِکَلِمَاتِهِ»: به وسیله کلمات خود. مراد فرموده‌های نازل بر انبیاء، دستور پیدایش اشیاء توسّط فرمان (کُنْ)، نیروهای عامل و کارآ و متصرّف در هستی که به منزله کارگزاران خدایند (نگا: نساء / 171، نحل / 40 تفسیر عبدالکریم الخطیب).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و خداوند به کلمات خویش حق را به کرسی می‌نشاند، ولو آنکه گناهکاران ناخوش داشته باشند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: او حق را به وعده خویش، تحقق می‌بخشد؛ هر چند مجرمان کراهت داشته باشند!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بپای می‌دارد خدا حقّ را به سخنان خویش و اگر چه خوش ندارند گنهکاران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و خداى با سخنان- حكم يا نهادهاى- خود حق را ثابت و پايدار كند اگر چه بزهكاران خوش ندارند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و خدا با کلمات خود، حق را پای‌برجا و راست می‌آورد؛ هر چند بزهکاران را هرگز خوش نیاید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: God vindicates the truth by His commands, however the sinners may dislike it."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “And Allah will prove the truth by His Words, even if the guilty get annoyed.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: God verifies the truth by His words, though sinners be averse.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And Allah justifieth the truth according to His words, even though the culprits may detest.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "And Allah will establish and make apparent the truth by His Words, however much the Mujrimun (criminals, disbelievers, polytheists, sinners, etc.) may hate it."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “And God upholds the truth with His words, even though the sinners detest it.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Allah vindicates the truth by His commands, howsoever much the guilty might detest that.'

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "And Allah will establish and make apparent the truth by His Words, however much the criminals may hate (it)."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And Allah will vindicate the Truth by His words, however much the guilty be averse.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Allah will confirm the truth with His words, though the guilty should be averse.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Allah verifies the truth by His Words, even though the sinners hate it.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And Allah will establish the truth by His words, even if the criminals dislike it."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: God will make the Truth stand supreme by His words, even though the wicked people dislike it."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And Allah will show the truth to be the truth by His words, though the guilty may be averse (to it).

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wayuhiqqu Allahu alhaqqa bikalimatihi walaw kariha almujrimoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: God establishes the truth by His words, however much the sinners may dislike it."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "And Allah by His words doth prove and establish His truth, however much the sinners may hate it!"

verses.text: فَمَا آمَنَ‌ لِمُوسَى‌ إِلاَّ ذُرِّيَّةٌ مِنْ‌ قَوْمِهِ‌ عَلَى‌ خَوْفٍ‌ مِنْ‌ فِرْعَوْنَ‌ وَ مَلَئِهِمْ‌ أَنْ‌ يَفْتِنَهُمْ‌ وَ إِنَ‌ فِرْعَوْنَ‌ لَعَالٍ‌ فِي‌ الْأَرْضِ‌ وَ إِنَّهُ‌ لَمِنَ‌ الْمُسْرِفِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس [در ابتدای کار] کسی به موسی ایمان نیاورد، مگر فرزندانی [انگشت شمار] از قومش آن هم با ترسی [شدید] از فرعون و اشراف و سران قوم خودشان که مبادا فرعونیان آنان را شکنجه و عذاب دهند؛ و مسلماً فرعون در سرزمین مصر برتری خواه، و [در گناه، معصیت و ستم] از اسراف کاران بود.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: از بيم آزار فرعون و مهتران قوم او، جز گروهى از آنها به موسى ايمان نياوردند. و فرعون در زمين برترى مى‌جست و او از گزافكاران بود.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و جز گروهى از فرزندان قوم موسى به او ايمان نياوردند، آن هم با ترسى از فرعون و اشراف وى كه مبادا عقوبتشان كند. به راستى فرعون در [آن‌] سرزمين خيلى سركش و از افراطكاران بود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: سرانجام، كسى به موسى ايمان نياورد مگر فرزندانى از قوم وى، در حالى كه بيم داشتند از آنكه مبادا فرعون و سران آنها ايشان را آزار رسانند، و در حقيقت، فرعون در آن سرزمين برترى‌جوى و از اسرافكاران بود.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس کسی به موسی ایمان نیاورد جز قبیله او آن هم با حال خوف و تقیه از فرعون و مهتران اتباعش که مبادا فرعون در صدد فتنه و قتلشان برآید که فرعون در سرزمین مصر بسیار علوّ و سرکشی داشت و سخت متعدّی و ستمکار بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هیچ کس به موسی ایمان نیاورد مگر گروهی از مردمان قومش، (که ایمان آوردند) و از فرعون و درباریان و اشراف بنی‌اسرائیل می‌ترسیدند که (شکنجه و آزارشان رسانند و) آنان را از دین برگردانند. بیگمان فرعون در زمین عَلَم طغیان برافراشته بود و گردنکشی کرده بود و از زمره‌ی متجاوزان (در ظلم و فساد و جنایت و خونریزی) بود. [[«عَلَی خَوْفٍ مِّن فِرْعَوْنَ»: با وجود ترس از فرعون. واژه (عَلی) به معنی (مَعَ) است (نگا: انسان / 8). «أَن یَفْتِنَهُمْ»: آنان را از دین برگردانند. ایشان را اذیّت و آزار رسانند (نگا: بقره / 191). «لَعَالٍ فی الْأَرْضِ»: برتری‌جوئی و گردنکشی در زمین می‌کرد. «الْمُسْرِفِینَ»: اسرافکاران. در اینجا مراد کسانی است که شرّ و فساد زیادی می‌کردند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: لذا به موسی جز زاد و رودی [اندکشمار] از قومش ایمان نیاوردند، آن هم با ترس از فرعون و بزرگان قومش که مبادا ایشان را در بلا افکند، و فرعون در آن سرزمین گردنکش بود و همو از تجاوزگران بود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (در آغاز،) هیچ کس به موسی ایمان نیاورد، مگر گروهی از فرزندان قوم او؛ (آن هم) با ترس از فرعون و اطرافیانش، مبادا آنها را شکنجه کنند؛ زیرا فرعون، برتری‌جویی در زمین داشت؛ و از اسرافکاران بود!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس ایمان نیاورد برای موسی جز تیره‌ای از قومش با ترسی از فرعون و کسان او نبادا برآشوبند بر ایشان و همانا فرعون برتری‌جوئی است در زمین و همانا او است از اسراف‌کنندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس به موسى جز فرزندانى- ضعيفان و زيردستان- از قوم او ايمان نياوردند آنهم با ترسى از فرعون و مهترانشان كه [مبادا] شكنجه و عقوبتشان كند و همانا فرعون در زمين، سركش و برترى‌جوى و از گزافكاران بود.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس (سرانجام) کسانی برای موسی ایمان نیاوردند مگر گروهی اندک از قوم وی [:فرعون]، در حالی که بیم داشتند از آنکه مبادا فرعون و سرانشان ایشان را عذابی آتش‌بار رسانند. حال آنکه فرعون در آن سرزمین بی‌چون بسی زبردست و (هم) او بی‌گمان از اسرافکاران است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But none of them put faith in Moses except some youths among his people who were nonetheless afraid lest the Pharaoh and his nobles should persecute them; for the Pharaoh was mighty in the land, and guilty of excesses.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So none accepted faith in Moosa, except a few descendants of his people, fearing Firaun and his court members, that they would force them to revert; and indeed Firaun was a rebel in the land; and indeed he crossed the limits.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So none believed in Moses, save a seed of his people, for fear of Pharaoh and their Council, that they would persecute them; and Pharaoh was high in the land, and he was one of the prodigals.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then none believed in Musa save a posterity of his people, through fear of Fir'awn and their chiefs, lest he should persecute them; and verily Fir'awn was lofty in the land, and verily he was of the extravagant.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: But none believed in Musa (Moses) except the offspring of his people, because of the fear of Fir'aun (Pharaoh) and his chiefs, lest they should persecute them; and verily, Fir'aun (Pharaoh) was arrogant tyrant on the earth, he was indeed one of the Musrifun (polytheists, sinners and transgressors, those who give up the truth and follow the evil, and commit all kinds of great sins).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But none believed in Moses except some children of his people, for fear that Pharaoh and his chiefs would persecute them. Pharaoh was high and mighty in the land. He was a tyrant.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: None but a few youths of Moses' people accepted him, fearing that Pharaoh and their own chiefs would persecute them. Indeed Pharaoh was mighty in the land, he was among those who exceed all limits.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: But none believed in Musa except the offspring of his people, because of the fear of Fir`awn and his chiefs, lest they should persecute them; and verily, Fir`awn was an arrogant tyrant on the earth, he was indeed one of the transgressors.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: But none trusted Moses, save some scions of his people, (and they were) in fear of Pharaoh and their chiefs, that he would persecute them. Lo! Pharaoh was verily a tyrant in the land, and lo! he verily was of the wanton.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: But none believed in Moses except some youths from among his people, for the fear of Pharaoh and his elite that he would persecute them. For Pharaoh was indeed a tyrant in the land, and indeed he was an unrestrained [despot].

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: So none believed Moses except a few of his nation because they feared that Pharaoh and their Council would persecute them. Pharaoh was mighty in theland, and one of the evildoers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But no one believed Moses, except [some] youths among his people, for fear of Pharaoh and his establishment that they would persecute them. And indeed, Pharaoh was haughty within the land, and indeed, he was of the transgressors

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: No one believed in Moses except some young people of his own tribe who were at the same time very afraid of the persecution of the Pharaoh and his people. The Pharaoh was certainly a tyrant and a transgressor.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: But none believed in Musa except the offspring of his people, on account of the fear of Firon and their chiefs, lest he should persecute them; and most surely Firon was lofty in the land; and most surely he was of the extravagant.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fama amana limoosa illa thurriyyatun min qawmihi AAala khawfin min firAAawna wamalaihim an yaftinahum wainna firAAawna laAAalin fee alardi wainnahu lamina almusrifeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: But none save a few youths declared their faith in Moses, [while others held back] for fear that Pharaoh and his nobles would persecute them. Pharaoh was high and mighty in the land. And one who transgressed all bounds.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But none believed in Moses except some children of his people, because of the fear of Pharaoh and his chiefs, lest they should persecute them; and certainly Pharaoh was mighty on the earth and one who transgressed all bounds.

verses.text: وَ قَالَ‌ مُوسَى‌ يَا قَوْمِ‌ إِنْ‌ کُنْتُمْ‌ آمَنْتُمْ‌ بِاللَّهِ‌ فَعَلَيْهِ‌ تَوَکَّلُوا إِنْ‌ کُنْتُمْ‌ مُسْلِمِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و موسی گفت: ای قوم من! اگر به خدا ایمان آورده اید، پس بر او توکل کنید اگر از تسلیم شدگان [در برابر فرمان های حق] هستید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: موسى گفت: اى قوم من، اگر به خدا ايمان آورده‌ايد و تسليم فرمان هستيد به او توكل كنيد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و موسى گفت: اى قوم من! اگر به خدا ايمان آورده‌ايد، فقط بر او توكل كنيد اگر سر تسليم داريد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و موسى گفت: «اى قوم من، اگر به خدا ايمان آورده‌ايد، و اگر اهل تسليميد بر او توكّل كنيد.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و موسی گفت که ای قوم من، شما اگر به حقیقت ایمان به خدا آورده و اگر به راستی تسلیم فرمان او هستید بر او توکل کنید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: موسی (برای دلداری و تشجیع مؤمنان) گفت: ای قوم من! اگر واقعاً به خدا ایمان دارید بر او توکّل کنید (و باید بر او توکّل کنید) اگر خود را بدو تسلیم کرده‌اید. [[«إِن کُنتُمْ ...»: برخی دو چیز را به دو شرط تعلیق کرده‌اند و معنی آیه همان است که گذشت. برخی هم تعلیق یک چیز را به دو شرط جائز دانسته‌اند و معنی چنین می‌شود: اگر خود را تسلیم خدا کرده‌اید و اگر واقعاً به خدا ایمان دارید، بر او توکّل کنید. «مُسْلِمِینَ»: فرمانبرداران. تسلیم‌کنندگان خود به خدا.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و موسی گفت ای قوم من، اگر به خداوند ایمان آورده‌اید و اگر اهل تسلیم هستید، پس بر او توکل کنید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: موسی گفت: «ای قوم من! اگر شما به خدا ایمان آورده‌اید، بر او توکّل کنید اگر تسلیم فرمان او هستید!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و گفت موسی ای قوم اگر ایمان آوردید به خدا پس بر او توکل کنید اگر هستید مسلمانان (تسلیم‌شدگان)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و موسى گفت: اى قوم من، اگر به خداى ايمان آورده‌ايد، پس بر او توكل كنيد اگر مسلمانيد- گردن نهاده‌ايد-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و موسی گفت: «ای قوم من! اگر به خدا ایمان آورده بوده‌اید (و) اگر (در برابرش) مسلِم بوده‌اید پس بر او توکل کنید.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Moses said: "O my people, if you do believe in God place your trust in Him if you are obedient."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And Moosa said, “O my people! If you have accepted faith in Allah, then you should rely only upon Him, if you are Muslims.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Moses said, 'O my people, if you believe in God, in Him put your trust, if you have surrendered.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And Musa said: my people! if ye have been believing in Allah, then on Him rely, if ye are muslims.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And Musa (Moses) said: "O my people! If you have believed in Allah, then put your trust in Him if you are Muslims (those who submit to Allah's Will)."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Moses said, “O my people, if you have believed in God, then put your trust in Him, if you have submitted.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Moses said: 'My people! If you believe in Allah and are truly Muslims then place your reliance on Him alone.'

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And Musa said: "O my people! If you have believed in Allah, then put your trust in Him if you are Muslims."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And Moses said: O my people! If ye have believed in Allah then put trust in Him, if ye have indeed surrendered (unto Him)!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And Moses said, ‘O my people! If you have faith in Allah, put your trust in Him, if you have submitted [to Him].’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Moses said: 'O my nation, if you believe in Allah, put your trust in Him, if you have surrendered (Muslims)'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And Moses said, "O my people, if you have believed in Allah, then rely upon Him, if you should be Muslims."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Moses told his people, "If you have submitted yourselves to God and have faith in Him, put your trust in Him".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And Musa said: O my people! if you believe in Allah, then rely on Him (alone) if you submit (to Allah).

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waqala moosa ya qawmi in kuntum amantum biAllahi faAAalayhi tawakkaloo in kuntum muslimeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Moses said, "O my people; if you believe in God, [and] if you have surrendered yourselves to Him, then in Him alone put your trust."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Moses said: "O my people! If ye do (really) believe in Allah, then in Him put your trust if ye submit (your will to His)."

verses.text: فَقَالُوا عَلَى‌ اللَّهِ‌ تَوَکَّلْنَا رَبَّنَا لاَ تَجْعَلْنَا فِتْنَةً لِلْقَوْمِ‌ الظَّالِمِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس گفتند: ما فقط بر خدا توکل کردیم. پروردگارا! ما را دستخوش شکنجه و عذاب ستمکاران قرار مده.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفتند: بر خدا توكل كرديم، اى پروردگار ما، ما را مغلوب اين مردم ستمكار مكن.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفتند: تنها بر خدا توكل كرديم. پروردگارا! ما را مايه آزمون و آزار قوم ستمگر قرار مده

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس گفتند: «بر خدا توكّل كرديم. پروردگارا، ما را براى قوم ستمگر [وسيله‌] آزمايش قرار مده.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پیروان موسی نیز همه گفتند: ما بر خدا توکل کردیم، بار الها ما را دستخوش فتنه اشرار و قوم ستمکار مگردان.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پس مؤمنان گفتند: بر خدا توکّل می‌کنیم و بس. پروردگارا! ما را (وسیله‌ی) آزمون مردمان ستمکار و (آماج) بلا و آزار کافران (بدکردار) مساز. [[«فِتْنَةً»: امتحان و آزمایش. فتنه و بلا. مراد این است که پروردگارا کافران را با اذیّت و آزار رساندنشان به ما آزمایش مکن که تاب و توان شکنجه ستمکاران را نداریم. یا این که: پروردگارا ما را نشانه تیر بلای ستمکاران و مقهور و مغلوب ایشان مگردان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: در پاسخ گفتند بر خداوند توکل کردیم، پروردگارا ما را دستخوش ستمگران مگردان‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: گفتند: «تنها بر خدا توکل داریم؛ پروردگارا! ما را مورد شکنجه گروه ستمگر قرار مده!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفتند بر خدا توکّل کردیم پروردگارا نگردان ما را دستخوش گروه ستمکاران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس گفتند: بر خدا توكل كرديم پروردگارا، ما را مايه آزمون گروه ستمكاران- دستخوش شكنجه و آزار آنها- قرار مده.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس گفتند: «تنها بر خدا توکل کردیم. پروردگارمان! ما را برای گروه ستمگران (مورد) آزمایشی آتش‌بار قرار مده.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They answered: "We have placed our trust in God. O Lord, do not make us a target of oppression for these tyrannical people,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They said, “We have relied only upon Allah; Our Lord! Do not make us a test* for the unjust people.” (* By giving them power over us.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They said, 'In God we have put our trust. Our Lord, make us not a temptation to the people of the evildoers,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: So they said: on Allah We rely, our Lord! make us not a trial for the wrong-doing people.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They said: "In Allah we put our trust. Our Lord! Make us not a trial for the folk who are Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doing) (i.e. do not make them overpower us).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They said, “In God we have put our trust. Our Lord, do not make us victims of the oppressive people.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They replied: 'We place our reliance on Allah. Our Lord! Do not make us a trial for the oppressors,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They said: "In Allah we put our trust. Our Lord! Make us not a trial for the folk who are wrongdoers.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: They said: In Allah we put trust. Our Lord! Oh, make us not a lure for the wrongdoing folk;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Whereat they said, ‘In Allah we have put our trust.’ ‘Our Lord! Do not make us a [means of] test for the wrongdoing lot,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They said: 'We have put our trust in Allah. Our Lord, do not let us be a temptation to the harmdoing nation.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So they said, "Upon Allah do we rely. Our Lord, make us not [objects of] trial for the wrongdoing people

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They said, "In God do we trust. Lord, do not subject us to the persecution of the unjust ones,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So they said: On Allah we rely: O our Lord! make us not subject to the persecution of the unjust people:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faqaloo AAala Allahi tawakkalna rabbana la tajAAalna fitnatan lilqawmi alththalimeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They said, "In God we put our trust. Our Lord,  make us not a trial [the subject of persecution] for the oppressors.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They said: "In Allah do we put out trust. Our Lord! make us not a trial for those who practise oppression;

verses.text: وَ نَجِّنَا بِرَحْمَتِکَ‌ مِنَ‌ الْقَوْمِ‌ الْکَافِرِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و ما را به رحمتت از گروه کافران رهایی ده.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و به رحمت خود ما را از اين كافران رهايى بخش.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و ما را به رحمت خويش از قوم كافر رهايى بخش

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: «و ما را به رحمت خويش، از گروه كافران نجات ده.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و ما را به رحمت و لطف خود از شر کافران نجات ده.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و ما را با فضل و رحمت خود از دست مردمان کافر نجات بده.

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و ما را به رحمت خویش از خدانشناسان رهایی بخش‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و ما را با رحمتت از (دست) قوم کافر رهایی بخش!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بِرهان ما را به رحمت خود از گروه کافران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و ما را به مِهر و بخشايش خود از گروه كافران برهان.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: « و ما را به رحمت خویش، از گروه کافران نجات‌بخش.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And deliver us by Your grace from a people who do not believe."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “And with Your mercy, rescue us from the disbelievers.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and deliver us by Thy mercy from the people of the unbelievers.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And deliver us in Thine mercy from the disbelieving people.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "And save us by Your Mercy from the disbelieving folk."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “And deliver us, by Your mercy, from the disbelieving people.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and deliver us, through Your mercy, from the unbelievers.'

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "And save us by Your mercy from the disbelieving folk."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And, of Thy mercy, save us from the folk that disbelieve.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and deliver us by Your mercy from the faithless lot.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Save us, through Your Mercy, from the unbelieving nation'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And save us by Your mercy from the disbelieving people."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Lord, save us, through Your mercy, from the disbelieving people."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And do Thou deliver us by Thy mercy from the unbelieving people.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wanajjina birahmatika mina alqawmi alkafireena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: And deliver us by Your mercy from the people who deny the truth."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "And deliver us by Thy Mercy from those who reject (Thee)."

verses.text: وَ أَوْحَيْنَا إِلَى‌ مُوسَى‌ وَ أَخِيهِ‌ أَنْ‌ تَبَوَّءَا لِقَوْمِکُمَا بِمِصْرَ بُيُوتاً وَ اجْعَلُوا بُيُوتَکُمْ‌ قِبْلَةً وَ أَقِيمُوا الصَّلاَةَ وَ بَشِّرِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و به موسی و برادرش وحی کردیم که خانه هایی در سرزمین مصر برای قوم خود فراهم آورید، و خانه هایتان را روبروی هم قرار دهید، و نماز را برپا دارید، و مؤمنان را [به رهایی از چنگال فرعونیان] مژده ده.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: به موسى و برادرش وحى كرديم كه براى قوم خود در مصر خانه‌هايى مهيا كنيد و خانه‌هاى خود را عبادتگاه سازيد و نمازگزاريد و مؤمنان را بشارت ده.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و به موسى و برادرش وحى كرديم كه براى قوم خود در مصر خانه‌هايى ترتيب دهيد و خانه‌هاى خويش را [به خاطر امنيّت‌] رو به روى هم قرار دهيد و نماز برپا داريد و مؤمنان را مژده ده

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و به موسى و برادرش وحى كرديم كه شما دو تن براى قوم خود در مصر خانه‌هايى ترتيب دهيد و سراهايتان را رو به روى هم قرار دهيد و نماز برپا داريد و مؤمنان را مژده ده.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و به موسی و برادرش (هارون) وحی کردیم که شما برای پیروانتان در شهر مصر منزل گیرید و (اکنون که از بیم فرعونیان به مساجد نتوانید رفت)، خانه‌هایتان را قبله و معبد خود قرار دهید و نماز به پا دارید و (تو هم ای رسول) مؤمنان را (به فتح در دنیا و بهشت در آخرت) بشارت ده.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و به موسی و برادرش (هارون) وحی کردیم که برای قوم خود خانه‌هائی در سرزمین مصر برگزینید و خانه‌هایتان را مقابل یکدیگر بسازید و (در آنجاها، به دور از چشم فرعون و فرعونیان) نماز را برپای دارید، و به ایمانداران مژده بده (که سرانجام پیروز می‌شوند و در دنیا نصرت و در آخرت جنّت از آن ایشان می‌گردد). [[«تَبَوَّآ»: انتخاب کنید. مأوی بسازید. «قِبْلَةً»: مقابل یکدیگر و نزدیک به هم. قبله نماز که مراد مصلّی و محلّ برگزاری نماز است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و به موسی و برادرش وحی کردیم که قومتان را در مصر در خانه‌هایی سکنا دهید و خانه‌هایتان را [رو به‌] قبله کنید و نماز را برپا دارید و مؤمنان را بشارت ده‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و به موسی و برادرش وحی کردیم که: «برای قوم خود، خانه‌هایی در سرزمین مصر انتخاب کنید؛ و خانه‌هایتان را مقابل یکدیگر (و متمرکز) قرار دهید! و نماز را برپا دارید! و به مؤمنان بشارت ده (که سرانجام پیروز می‌شوند!)»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و وحی نمودیم به موسی و برادرش که برگیرید برای قوم خویش در مصر (شهر) خانه‌هائی و بگردانید خانه‌های خویش را قبله و بپای دارید نماز را و بشارت ده به مؤمنان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و به موسى و برادرش وحى كرديم كه براى قوم خود در مصر خانه‌هايى آماده سازيد و خانه‌هاى خود را پرستشگاه- يا روبروى هم- قرار دهيد و نماز را برپا داريد، و مؤمنان را مژده ده.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و فراسوی موسی و برادرش وحی کردیم که: «شما دو تن برای قوم خود در مصر خانه‌هایی آماده کنید و سراهایتان را رویارویتان و هم قبله‌گاه (و ملجأ و پیشوای) مردمان قرار دهید و نماز را بر پا بدارید.» و مؤمنان را بشارت ده.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We commanded Moses and his brother: "Build homes for your people in Egypt, and make your houses places of worship, perform your acts of prayer and give happy tidings to those who believe."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We sent the divine revelation to Moosa and his brother that, “Build houses for your people in Egypt and make your houses as places of worship, and keep the prayer established, and give glad tidings to the Muslims.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And We revealed to Moses and his brother, 'Take you, for your people, in Egypt certain houses; and make your houses a direction for men to pray to; and perform the prayer; and do thou give good tidings to the believers.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We Revealed unto Musa and his brother: inhabit houses for your people in Misr, and make your houses a place of Worship, and establish prayer, and give glad tidings to the believers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And We inspired Musa (Moses) and his brother (saying): "Take dwellings for your people in Egypt, and make your dwellings as places for your worship, and perform As-Salat (Iqamat-as-Salat), and give glad tidings to the believers."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And We inspired Moses and his brother, “Settle your people in Egypt, and make your homes places of worship, and perform the prayer, and give good news to the believers.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And We directed Moses and his brother: 'Prepare a few houses for your people in Egypt, and make your houses a direction for men to pray, and establish Prayer, and give glad tidings to the men of faith.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And We revealed to Musa and his brother (saying): "Provide dwellings for your people in Egypt, and make your dwellings as places for your worship, and perform the Salah, and give glad tidings to the believers."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And We inspired Moses and his brother, (saying): Appoint houses for your people in Egypt and make your houses oratories, and establish worship. And give good news to the believers.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: We revealed to Moses and his brother [saying], ‘Settle your people in the city, and let your houses face each other, and maintain the prayer, and give good news to the faithful.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We revealed to Moses and his brother: 'Take certain houses for your people in Egypt. Make your houses a direction (for pray); establish the prayer; and give glad tidings to the believers'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We inspired to Moses and his brother, "Settle your people in Egypt in houses and make your houses [facing the] qiblah and establish prayer and give good tidings to the believers."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We sent a revelation to Moses and his brother to build houses for their people in the Pharaoh's town and to build them facing one another. (We told him) that therein they should pray and that Moses should give the glad news (of God's mercy) to the faithful ones.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We revealed to Musa and his brother, saying: Take for your people houses to abide in Egypt and make your houses places of worship and keep up prayer and give good news to the believers.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waawhayna ila moosa waakheehi an tabawwaa liqawmikuma bimisra buyootan waijAAaloo buyootakum qiblatan waaqeemoo alssalata wabashshiri almumineena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We revealed [Our will] to Moses and his brother, saying, "Set aside for your people some houses in the city and turn them into places of worship, and be constant in prayer! And give [O Moses] the good news to the believers."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: We inspired Moses and his brother with this Message: "Provide dwellings for your people in Egypt, make your dwellings into places of worship, and establish regular prayers: and give glad tidings to those who believe!"

verses.text: وَ قَالَ‌ مُوسَى‌ رَبَّنَا إِنَّکَ‌ آتَيْتَ‌ فِرْعَوْنَ‌ وَ مَلَأَهُ‌ زِينَةً وَ أَمْوَالاً فِي‌ الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا رَبَّنَا لِيُضِلُّوا عَنْ‌ سَبِيلِکَ‌ رَبَّنَا اطْمِسْ‌ عَلَى‌ أَمْوَالِهِمْ‌ وَ اشْدُدْ عَلَى‌ قُلُوبِهِمْ‌ فَلاَ يُؤْمِنُوا حَتَّى‌ يَرَوُا الْعَذَابَ‌ الْأَلِيمَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و موسی گفت: پروردگارا! فرعون و اشراف و سرانش را در زندگی دنیا زیور و زینت [بسیار] و اموال [فراوان] داده ای که [نهایتاً مردم را] از راه تو گمراه کنند، پروردگارا! اموالشان را نابود کن و دل هایشان را سخت گردان که ایمان نیاورند تا آنکه عذاب دردناک را ببینند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: موسى گفت: اى پروردگار ما، به فرعون و مهتران قومش در اين جهان زينت و اموال داده‌اى، اى پروردگار ما، تا ديگران را از طريق تو گمراه كنند. اى پروردگار ما، اموالشان را تباه ساز و دلشان را سخت كن. ايمان نمى‌آورند تا آنگاه كه عذاب دردآور را بنگرند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و موسى گفت: پروردگارا! تو فرعون و مهترانش را در زندگى دنيا زينت و مال و منال داده‌اى، پروردگارا، تا [بندگانت را] از راه تو گمراه كنند. پروردگارا! اموالشان را نابود و دل‌هايشان را سخت گردان كه ايمان نياورند تا عذاب دردناك را ببينند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و موسى گفت: «پروردگارا، تو به فرعون و اشرافش در زندگى دنيا زيور و اموال داده‌اى، پروردگارا، تا [خلق را] از راه تو گمراه كنند، پروردگارا، اموالشان را نابود كن و آنان را دل‌سخت گردان كه ايمان نياورند تا عذاب دردناك را ببينند.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و موسی عرض کرد: بار الها تو به فرعون و فرعونیان در حیات دنیا ملک و اموال و زیورهای بسیار بخشیدی که-پروردگارا-بدین وسیله بندگان را از راه تو گمراه کنند، بار خدایا، اموال آنها را نابود گردان و دلهایشان را سخت بربند که ایمان نیاورند تا هنگامی که عذاب دردناک را مشاهده کنند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (هنگامی که کینه‌توزی کافران و اذیّت و آزار ایشان با موسی به غایت رسید) موسی گفت: پروردگارا! تو به فرعون و فرعونیان در دنیا زینت (و بهجت جهان، یعنی فرزندان و قدرت فراوان و نعمت) و دارائی (سرشار) داده‌ای، و عاقبتِ آن این شده است که (بندگانت را) از راه تو به در می‌برند و گمراهشان می‌کنند. پروردگارا! اموالشان را نابود گردان و بر دلهایشان (بند قسوت را) محکم کن، تا ایمان نیاورند مگر آن گاه که به عذاب دردناک (دوزخ) گرفتار آیند (که آن وقت توبه و پشیمانی دیگر سودی ندارد). [[«زِینَةً»: بهجت. دارائی و فرزندان (نگا: کهف / 46، قصص / 79 - 82). «لِیُضِلُّوا»: تا عاقبت کارشان بدانجا بکشد که دیگران را گمراه کنند. حرف (لِ)، لام عاقبت است. «إِطْمِسْ»: از میان ببر. بیسود و بی‌اثر کن. «أُشْدُدْ عَلَی قُلُوبِهِمْ»: دریچه سراچه دلهایشان را محکم ببند. بند کیسه دلهایشان را سفت و سخت ببند تا نور و مدد الهی به داخل آنها نرود و قدرت تفکّر و اندیشه از آنان سلب شود.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و موسی گفت پروردگارا تو به فرعون و بزرگان قومش در زندگانی دنیا، زینت و مال و منال بخشیدی، پروردگارا، که سرانجام [مردمان را] از راه تو گمراه دارند، پروردگارا اموالشان را بی‌برکت گردان و دلهایشان را سخت کن که تا زمانی که عذاب الیم را ببینند، ایمان نیاورند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: موسی گفت: «پروردگارا! تو فرعون و اطرافیانش را زینت و اموالی (سرشار) در زندگی دنیا داده‌ای، پروردگارا! در نتیجه (بندگانت را) از راه تو گمراه می‌سازند! پروردگارا! اموالشان را نابود کن! و (بجرم گناهانشان،) دلهایشان را سخت و سنگین ساز، به گونه‌ای که ایمان نیاورند تا عذاب دردناک را ببینند!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و گفت موسی پروردگارا همانا دادی فرعون و کسانش را زیوری و مالهائی در زندگانی دنیا تا گمراه کنند از راهت پروردگارا تباه ساز اموال آنان را و ببند دلهای آنان را که ایمان نیارند تا بنگرند عذاب دردناک را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و موسى گفت: پروردگارا، همانا تو به فرعون و مهترانش در زندگى اين جهان زيورها و مالها داده‌اى، پروردگارا، تا [بدان وسيله مردم را] از راه تو گمراه كنند خداوندا، مالهاشان را نابود كن و بر دلهاشان سخت بند نِه كه ايمان نياورند تا عذاب دردناك را ببينند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و موسی گفت: «پروردگارمان! تو به فرعون و اشرافش در زندگی دنیا زیوری و اموالی بسیار داده‌ای - پروردگارمان!- تا (دیگران را) از راه تو به بیراهه کشند. پروردگارمان! اموالشان را محو و نابود کن و آنان را سخت‌دل گردان (چنان)که ایمان نیاورند، تا (هنگامی که) آن عذاب دردناک را ببینند.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And Moses said: "O Lord, have You bestowed on the Pharaoh and his nobles pomp and plenty in the life of this world that they might mislead people from Your path? Destroy their possessions, O Lord, and harden their hearts that they may not believe until they face the painful punishment."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And Moosa prayed, “Our Lord! You have given Firaun and his chiefs adornment and wealth in the life of this world, our Lord, that they may lead astray from Your path; our Lord! Destroy their riches and harden their hearts so that they may not accept faith until they witness the painful punishment.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Moses said, 'Our Lord, Thou hast given to Pharaoh and his Council adornment and possessions in this present life. Our Lord, let them go astray from Thy way; Our Lord, obliterate their possessions, and harden their hearts so that they do not believe, till they see the painful chastisement.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And Musa said: our Lord! verily Thou! Thou hast vouchsafed unto Fir'awn and his chiefs adornment and riches in the life of the world, Our Lord, that they may lead men astray from Thine way. Our Lord! wipe out their riches, and harden their hearts, so that they may not believe until they behold the torment afflictive.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And Musa (Moses) said: "Our Lord! You have indeed bestowed on Fir'aun (Pharaoh) and his chiefs splendour and wealth in the life of this world, our Lord! That they may lead men astray from Your Path. Our Lord! Destroy their wealth, and harden their hearts, so that they will not believe until they see the painful torment."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Moses said, “Our Lord, you have given Pharaoh and his chiefs splendor and wealth in the worldly life. Our Lord, for them to lead away from Your path. Our Lord, obliterate their wealth, and harden their hearts, they will not believe until they see the painful torment.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Moses prayed: 'Our Lord! You bestowed upon Pharaoh and his nobles splendour and riches in the world. Our Lord! Have You done this that they may lead people astray from Your path? Our Lord! Obliterate their riches and harden their hearts that they may not believe until they observe the painful chastisement.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And Musa said: "Our Lord! You have indeed bestowed on Fir`awn and his chiefs splendor and wealth in the life of this world, our Lord! That they may lead men astray from Your path. Our Lord! Destroy their wealth, and harden their hearts, so that they will not believe until they see the painful torment."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And Moses said: Our Lord! Lo! Thou hast given Pharaoh and his chiefs splendour and riches in the life of the world, Our Lord! that they may lead men astray from Thy way. Our Lord! Destroy their riches and harden their hearts so that they believe not till they see the painful doom.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Moses said, ‘Our Lord! You have given Pharaoh and his elite glamour and wealth in the life of this world, our Lord, that they may lead [people] astray from Your way! Our Lord! Blot out their wealth and harden their hearts so that they do not believe until they sight the painful punishment.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'Our Lord' supplicated Moses. 'You have given Pharaoh and his Council adornments and possessions in this life. Our Lord, let them go astray from YourPath. Our Lord, destroy their possessions and harden their hearts so that they shall not believe until they see the painful punishment.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And Moses said, "Our Lord, indeed You have given Pharaoh and his establishment splendor and wealth in the worldly life, our Lord, that they may lead [men] astray from Your way. Our Lord, obliterate their wealth and harden their hearts so that they will not believe until they see the painful punishment."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Moses said, "Lord, You have given the Pharaoh and his people great riches and splendor in this life and this makes them stray from Your path. Lord, destroy their wealth and harden their hearts in disbelief so that they will suffer the most painful torment".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And Musa said: Our Lord! surely Thou hast given to Firon and his chiefs finery and riches in this world's life, to this end, our Lord, that they lead (people) astray from Thy way: Our Lord! destroy their riches and harden their hearts so that they believe not until they see the painful punishment.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waqala moosa rabbana innaka atayta firAAawna wamalaahu zeenatan waamwalan fee alhayati alddunya rabbana liyudilloo AAan sabeelika rabbana itmis AAala amwalihim waoshdud AAala quloobihim fala yuminoo hatta yarawoo alAAathaba alaleema

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Moses prayed, "Our Lord, You have bestowed upon Pharaoh and his nobles pomp and wealth in the present life, whereby they lead people astray from Your path. Our Lord, destroy their riches and harden their hearts, so that they shall not believe until they are faced with grievous punishment."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Moses prayed: "Our Lord! Thou hast indeed bestowed on Pharaoh and his chiefs splendour and wealth in the life of the present, and so, Our Lord, they mislead (men) from Thy Path. Deface, our Lord, the features of their wealth, and send hardness to their hearts, so they will not believe until they see the grievous penalty."

verses.text: قَالَ‌ قَدْ أُجِيبَتْ‌ دَعْوَتُکُمَا فَاسْتَقِيمَا وَ لاَ تَتَّبِعَانِ‌ سَبِيلَ‌ الَّذِينَ‌ لاَ يَعْلَمُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [خدا] فرمود: دعای شما دو نفر پذیرفته شد؛ بنابراین [در ابلاغ پیام خدا] پابرجا واستوار باشید واز روش کسانی که جاهل و نادانند، پیروی نکنید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: خواست شما اجابت شد، ثابت‌قدم باشيد و از طريقه نادانان پيروى مكنيد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: فرمود: دعاى شما دو تن اجابت شد، پس استقامت كنيد و به راه جاهلان نرويد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: فرمود: «دعاى هر دوى شما پذيرفته شد. پس ايستادگى كنيد و راه كسانى را كه نمى‌دانند پيروى مكنيد.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: خدا فرمود: دعای شما مستجاب شد، پس هر دو استوار و پا برجا باشید و از راه مردم جاهل پیروی مکنید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: خدا فرمود: دعای شما (موسی و هارون) پذیرفته شد، پس بر راستای راه پابرجا باشید و استقامت به خرج دهید (و از انبوه مشکلات نهراسید) و از راه و برنامه‌ی کسانی پیروی نکنید که ناآگاهند. [[«أُجِیبَتْ»: پذیرفته شد. اجابت گردید. «إِسْتَقِیمَا»: در کار خود قاطع و ثابت قدم باشید. پایداری کنید و بر تبلیغ رسالت استوار بمانید.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: فرمود دعای شما دو تن اجابت شده است، پس پایداری کنید و از شیوه نادانان پیروی مکنید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: فرمود: «دعای شما پذیرفته شد! استقامت به خرج دهید؛ و از راه (و رسم) کسانی که نمی‌دانند، تبعیت نکنید!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت همانا مستجاب شد دعای شما پس پایداری کنید و پیروی نکنید راه آنان را که نمی‌دانند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [خداى‌] گفت: دعاى شما دو تن اجابت شد، پس استوار باشيد و هرگز از راه نادانان پيروى مكنيد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (پروردگار) فرمود: «درخواست شما هر دو پذیرفته شد. پس همواره پایداری جویید و راه کسانی را که نمی‌دانند هرگز پیروی مکنید.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Said (the Lord): "Your prayer is answered. Therefore persist and do not follow the path of those who are ignorant."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He said, “The prayer of you two is accepted, therefore remain firm, and do not follow the way of the unwise.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: He said, 'Your prayer is answered; so go you straight, and follow not the way of those that know not.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Allah said: surely the petition of you twain is accepted, so keep straight on, and follow not the path of those who know not.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Allah said: "Verily, the invocation of you both is accepted. So you both keep to the Straight Way (i.e. keep on doing good deeds and preaching Allah's Message with patience), and follow not the path of those who know not (the truth i.e. to believe in the Oneness of Allah, and also to believe in the Reward of Allah: Paradise, etc.)."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “Your prayer has been answered, so go straight, and do not follow the path of those who do not know.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Allah responded: 'The prayer of the two of you is accepted. So keep steadfast, and do not follow the path of the ignorant.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Allah said: "Verily, the invocation of you both is accepted. So you both keep to the straight way, and follow not the path of those who know not."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He said: Your prayer is heard. Do ye twain keep to the straight path, and follow not the road of those who have no knowledge.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Said He, ‘Your supplication has already been granted. So be steadfast, and do not follow the way of those who do not know.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He (Allah) said: 'Your supplication is answered; so go straight and do not follow the way of those who do not know'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Allah] said, "Your supplication has been answered." So remain on a right course and follow not the way of those who do not know."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The Lord replied, "Moses, the prayer of your brother and yourself has been heard. Both of you must be steadfast (in your faith) and must not follow the ignorant ones."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: The prayer of you both has indeed been accepted, therefore continue in the right way and do not follow the path of those who do not know.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala qad ojeebat daAAwatukuma faistaqeema wala tattabiAAanni sabeela allatheena la yaAAlamoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: God said, "Your prayer is granted, so continue, then, both of you, steadfastly on the right path, and do not follow the path of those who have no knowledge."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Allah said: "Accepted is your prayer (O Moses and Aaron)! So stand ye straight, and follow not the path of those who know not."

verses.text: وَ جَاوَزْنَا بِبَنِي‌ إِسْرَائِيلَ‌ الْبَحْرَ فَأَتْبَعَهُمْ‌ فِرْعَوْنُ‌ وَ جُنُودُهُ‌ بَغْياً وَ عَدْواً حَتَّى‌ إِذَا أَدْرَکَهُ‌ الْغَرَقُ‌ قَالَ‌ آمَنْتُ‌ أَنَّهُ‌ لاَ إِلٰهَ‌ إِلاَّ الَّذِي‌ آمَنَتْ‌ بِهِ‌ بَنُو إِسْرَائِيلَ‌ وَ أَنَا مِنَ‌ الْمُسْلِمِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: وبنی اسرائیل را از دریا گذراندیم، پس فرعون و لشکریانش آنان را از روی ستم وتجاوز دنبال کردندتا هنگامی که بلای غرق شدن، او را فروگرفت، گفت: ایمان آوردم که هیچ معبودی جز همان که بنی اسرائیل به او ایمان آوردند، نیست و من از تسلیم شدگان [در برابر فرمان های حق] هستم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ما بنى‌اسرائيل را از دريا گذرانيديم. فرعون و لشكريانش به قصد ستم و تعدى به تعقيبشان پرداختند. چون فرعون غرق مى‌شد گفت: ايمان آوردم كه هيچ خداوندى جز آن كه بنى‌اسرائيل بدان ايمان آورده‌اند نيست، و من از تسليم‌شدگانم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و بنى اسرائيل را از دريا عبور داديم. پس فرعون و سپاهش از سر ظلم و تجاوز آنها را دنبال كردند، تا چون غرق شدنش در رسيد، گفت: ايمان آوردم كه هيچ معبودى نيست جز همان كه بنى اسرائيل به او ايمان آوردند و من از تسليم شدگانم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و فرزندان اسرائيل را از دريا گذرانديم، پس فرعون و سپاهيانش از روى ستم و تجاوز، آنان را دنبال كردند، تا وقتى كه در شُرف غرق شدن قرار گرفت، گفت: «ايمان آوردم كه هيچ معبودى جز آنكه فرزندان اسرائيل به او گرويده‌اند، نيست، و من از تسليم‌شدگانم.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و ما بنی اسرائیل را از دریا گذرانیدیم پس آنگه فرعون و سپاهش به ظلم و ستمگری آنها را تعقیب کردند تا چون هنگام غرق فرعون فرا رسید گفت: اینک من ایمان آوردم که حقّا جز آن کسی که بنی اسرائیل به او ایمان دارند خدایی در عالم نیست و من هم از مسلمانان و اهل تسلیم فرمان او هستم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بنی‌اسرائیل را از دریا عبور دادیم. فرعون و لشکریانش، برای ظلم و تعدّی، آنان را دنبال کردند و در پی ایشان راه افتادند، تا بدانجا که (گذرگاه دریا به هم آمد و آب از هر سو ایشان را در برگرفت و) غرقاب فرعون را در خود پیچید. (در این هنگام بود که) گفت: ایمان دارم که خدائی وجود ندارد مگر آن خدائی که بنی‌اسرائیل بدو ایمان آورده‌اند و من از زمره‌ی فرمانبرداران (و مطیعان فرمان یزدان) هستم. [[«جَاوَزْنَا بِبَنِی إِسْرَآئِیلَ الْبَحْرَ»: بنی‌اسرائیل را از دریا گذراندیم. (بَنِی إِسْرآئِیلَ) مفعول اوّل، و (الْبَحْرَ) مفعول دوم است. «بَغْیاً وَ عَدْواً»: برای ظلم و تعدّی. ستمگرانه و متجاوزانه. این دو واژه، مفعولٌ‌له هستند و یا حال بوده و به معنی: (باغینَ وَ عادینَ) می‌باشند. «الْغَرَقُُ»: غرقاب. غرقابه. غرق شدن. «أَدْرَکَهُ الْغَرَقُ»: نزدیک غرق شدن بود.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و بنی‌اسرائیل را از دریا گذراندیم، آنگاه فرعون و سپاهیانش از روی ظلم و تجاوز سر در پی آنان نهادند، تا آنجا که او [فرعون‌] غرق شدن را نزدیک دید، گفت خدایی جز آنکه بنی‌اسرائیل به او ایمان آورده‌اند، نیست و من از اهل تسلیمم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (سرانجام) بنی اسرائیل را از دریا [= رود عظیم نیل‌] عبور دادیم؛ و فرعون و لشکرش از سر ظلم و تجاوز، به دنبال آنها رفتند؛ هنگامی که غرقاب دامن او را گرفت، گفت: «ایمان آوردم که هیچ معبودی، جز کسی که بنی اسرائیل به او ایمان آورده‌اند، وجود ندارد؛ و من از مسلمین هستم!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و گذراندیم بنی‌اسرائیل را از دریا پس پیروی کرد ایشان را فرعون و سپاه او به ستم و سرکشی تا گاهی که دریافت او را غرق گفت باور کردم که نیست خدائی جز آنکه ایمان بدو آوردند بنی‌اسرائیل و منم از مسلمانان (تسلیم‌شدگان)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و فرزندان اسرائيل را از دريا گذرانديم، پس فرعون و سپاهيانش از راه ستم و سركشى و تجاوز، آنان را دنبال كردند تا چون غرقاب او را بگرفت، گفت: ايمان آوردم كه خدايى نيست مگر آن كه فرزندان اسرائيل به او ايمان آوردند و من از گردن‌نهادگانم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و فرزندان اسرائیل را از دریا گذراندیم. پس فرعون و سپاهیانش -از روی ستم و تجاوز- به سرعت آنان را دنبال کردند. تا آن هنگام (و هنگامه‌ای) که غرق گریبانش را فرو گرفت. گفت: « (اکنون) ایمان آوردم که هیچ معبودی - جز آنکه فرزندان اسرائیل به او گرویده‌اند - نیست و من از تسلیم‌شوندگانم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And We brought the people of Israel across the sea, but the Pharaoh and his army pursued them wickedly and maliciously till he was on the point of drowning, and he said: "I believe that there is no god but He in whom the people of Israel believe, and I submit to Him."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We transported the Descendants of Israel across the sea, therefore Firaun and his army pursued them with rebellion and injustice; until when the drowning overcame him he cried, “I accept faith that there is no True God except the One in Whom the Descendants of Israel believe, and I am a Muslim.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And We brought the Children of Israel over the sea; and Pharaoh and his hosts followed them insolently and impetuously till, when the drowning overtook him, he said, 'I believe that there is no god but He in whom the Children of Israel believe; I am of those that surrender.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We led the Children of Isra'il across the sea; then Fir'awn and his hosts pursued them in rebellion and enmity, until, when the drowning over-took him, he said: I believe that verily He! there is no god but he, in whom the Children of Isra'il believe, and am of the Muslims.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And We took the Children of Israel across the sea, and Fir'aun (Pharaoh) with his hosts followed them in oppression and enmity, till when drowning overtook him, he said: "I believe that La ilaha illa (Huwa): (none has the right to be worshipped but) He," in Whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am one of the Muslims (those who submit to Allah's Will)."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And We delivered the Children of Israel across the sea. Pharaoh and his troops pursued them, defiantly and aggressively. Until, when he was about to drown, he said, “I believe that there is no god except the One the Children of Israel believe in, and I am of those who submit.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And We led the Children of Israel across the sea. Then Pharaoh and his hosts pursued them in iniquity and transgression until Pharaoh cried out while he was drowning: 'I believe that there is no god but Allah in Whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am also one of those who submit to Allah.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And We took the Children of Israel across the sea, and Fir`awn with his hosts followed them in oppression and enmity, till when drowning overtook him, he (Fira`wn) said: "I believe that none has the right to be worshipped but He in Whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am one of the Muslims."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And We brought the Children of Israel across the sea, and Pharaoh with his hosts pursued them in rebellion and transgression, till, when the (fate of) drowning overtook him, he exclaimed: I believe that there is no Allah save Him in Whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am of those who surrender (unto Him).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: We carried the Children of Israel across the sea, whereat Pharaoh and his troops pursued them, out of defiance and aggression. When overtaken by drowning, he called out, ‘I believe that there is no god except Him in whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am one of those who submit [to Him]!’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We brought the Children of Israel through the sea, and Pharaoh and his legions pursued them arrogantly and frantically. But as he was drowning he cried out: '(Now) I believe that there is no god except He in whom the Children of Israel believe. I am of those that surrender (Muslims)'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We took the Children of Israel across the sea, and Pharaoh and his soldiers pursued them in tyranny and enmity until, when drowning overtook him, he said, "I believe that there is no deity except that in whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am of the Muslims."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We helped the children of Israel cross the sea safely. The Pharaoh and his army pursued the children of Israel with wickedness and hate until the Pharaoh was drowned. As he was drowning the Pharaoh said, "I declare that there is no God but the One in whom the children of Israel believe and I have submitted to the Word of God".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We made the children of Israel to pass through the sea, then Firon and his hosts followed them for oppression and tyranny; until when drowning overtook him, he said: I believe that there is no god but He in Whom the children of Israel believe and I am of those who submit.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wajawazna bibanee israeela albahra faatbaAAahum firAAawnu wajunooduhu baghyan waAAadwan hatta itha adrakahu algharaqu qala amantu annahu la ilaha illa allathee amanat bihi banoo israeela waana mina almuslimeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: So We brought the Children of Israel across the sea. Pharaoh and his troops pursued them arrogantly and aggressively. When he was about to drown, [Pharaoh] exclaimed, "I believe that there is no deity save Him in whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am of those who surrender themselves to Him!"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: We took the Children of Israel across the sea: Pharaoh and his hosts followed them in insolence and spite.
