translations.text: Then, (when Allah's wrath falls upon the wicked) We save our Messengers and also those who believe. It is incumbent on Us to deliver the believers.' set fire to the whole city and its environs. The Assyrian king set his own palace ablaze and was himself burnt to death.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then We save Our Messengers and those who believe! Thus it is incumbent upon Us to save the believers.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then shall We save Our messengers and the believers, in like manner (as of old). It is incumbent upon Us to save believers.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then We shall deliver Our apostles and those who have faith. Thus, it is a must for Us to deliver the faithful.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Then we shall save Our Messengers and the believers. It is Our obligated duty, We shall save those who believe.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then We will save our messengers and those who have believed. Thus, it is an obligation upon Us that We save the believers

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We saved Our Messengers and those who believed; We must save the believers.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then We deliver Our apostles and those who believe-- even so (now), it is binding on Us (that) We deliver the believers.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Thumma nunajjee rusulana waallatheena amanoo kathalika haqqan AAalayna nunjee almumineena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Then We shall save Our messengers and those who believe. Thus We have made it incumbent upon Ourself to save the believers.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: In the end We deliver Our messengers and those who believe: Thus is it fitting on Our part that We should deliver those who believe!

verses.text: قُلْ‌ يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ‌ إِنْ‌ کُنْتُمْ‌ فِي‌ شَکٍ‌ مِنْ‌ دِينِي‌ فَلاَ أَعْبُدُ الَّذِينَ‌ تَعْبُدُونَ‌ مِنْ‌ دُونِ‌ اللَّهِ‌ وَ لٰکِنْ‌ أَعْبُدُ اللَّهَ‌ الَّذِي‌ يَتَوَفَّاکُمْ‌ وَ أُمِرْتُ‌ أَنْ‌ أَکُونَ‌ مِنَ‌ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بگو: ای مردم! اگر شما در [حقّانیّت] دین من تردید دارید [من در حقّانیّت دینم و بطلان آیین شما هیچ تردیدی ندارم] من آنهایی را که شما به جای خدا می پرستید، نمی پرستم، بلکه خدایی را می پرستم که جان همه شما را می ستاند، و من مأمورم که از مؤمنان باشم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بگو: اى مردم، اگر شما در دين من ترديد داريد، من چيزهايى را كه به جاى اللّه مى‌پرستيد نمى‌پرستم. من اللّه را مى‌پرستم كه شما را مى‌ميراند و مأمور شده‌ام كه از مؤمنان باشم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بگو: اى مردم! اگر در دين من ترديد داريد، [بدانيد كه‌] من آنهايى را كه جز خدا مى‌پرستيد نمى‌پرستم، بلكه خدايى را مى‌پرستم كه جان شما را مى‌ستاند و فرمان يافته‌ام كه از مؤمنان باشم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بگو: «اى مردم، اگر در دين من ترديد داريد، پس [بدانيد كه من‌] كسانى را كه به جاى خدا مى‌پرستيد نمى‌پرستم، بلكه خدايى را مى‌پرستم كه جان شما را مى‌ستاند، و دستور يافته‌ام كه از مؤمنان باشم.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بگو که ای مردم، اگر شما به آیین من شک دارید پس (یقین دارید که) من هرگز خدایان باطلی را که شما می‌پرستید نخواهم پرستید، بلکه تنها خدای یکتایی را که مرگ (و زندگانی) همه شما خلایق به امر اوست می‌پرستم و مأمورم که خود از اهل ایمان باشم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بگو: ای مردمان! اگر درباره‌ی آئین من در شکّ و تردید هستید (بدانید که) من کسانی را که بجز خدا می‌پرستید نمی‌پرستم، ولیکن خداوندی را می‌پرستم که شما را می‌میراند (و بعد از مرگ شما را زنده می‌گرداند و به سزای خود می‌رساند) و به من دستور داده شده است که از زمره‌ی مؤمنان باشم (آنان که خداوند ایشان را از عذاب دوزخ می‌رهاند و به بهشت نائل می‌گرداند). [[«مِن دُونِ اللهِ»: بجز خدا. به جای خدا. «یَتَوَفَّاکُمْ»: شما را می‌میراند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بگو ای مردم، اگر از دین من در شک هستید، بدانید که من کسانی را که به جای خداوند می‌پرستید، نمی‌پرستم، بلکه خدایی را می‌پرستم که [به هنگام‌] جان شما را می‌گیرد، و به من امر شده است که از مؤمنان باشم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بگو: «ای مردم! اگر در عقیده من شک دارید، من آنهایی را که جز خدا می‌پرستید، نمی‌پرستم! تنها خداوندی را پرستش می‌کنم که شما را می‌میراند! و من مأمورم که از مؤمنان باشم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بگو ای مردم اگر هستید در شکی از آئینم پس نمی‌پرستم آنان را که می‌پرستید جز خدا و لیکن پرستش کنم خداوندی را که دریابد (بمیراند) شما را و مأمور شدم که باشم از ایمان‌آورندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بگو: اى مردم، اگر از [درستى‌] دين من به شك اندريد، پس [بدانيد كه‌] من آنان را كه شما به جاى خدا مى‌پرستيد نمى‌پرستم بلكه خدايى را مى‌پرستم كه جان شما را مى‌ستاند و فرمان يافته‌ام كه از مؤمنان [به آن خدا] باشم

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بگو: «هان ای مردمان! اگر در دین من تردید داشته‌اید، پس من کسانی را که بجز خدا می‌پرستید نمی‌پرستم. بلکه خدایی را می‌پرستم که شما را می‌میراند و دستور یافته‌ام که از مؤمنان باشم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Say: "O men, if you have doubt about my faith, then (know) I do not worship those you worship apart from God, but I worship God who makes you die; and I am commanded to be a believer,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Say (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him), “O people! If you are in doubt concerning my religion, then (know that) I will never worship those whom you worship instead of Allah – but I worship Allah Who will give you death; and I am commanded to be of the believers.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Say: 'O men, if you are in doubt regarding my religion, I serve not those you serve apart from God, but I serve God, who will gather you to Him, and I am commanded to be of the believers, and:

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Say thou: ye men! if ye are in doubt concerning my religion-- then worship not those ye worship beside Allah, but I worship Allah who causeth you to die; and I am commanded that I should be of the believers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Say (O Muhammad SAW): "O you mankind! If you are in doubt as to my religion (Islam), then (know that) I will never worship those whom you worship, besides Allah. But I worship Allah Who causes you to die, I am commanded to be one of the believers.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Say, “O people, if you are in doubt about my religion—I do not serve those you serve apart from God. But I serve God, the one who will terminate your lives. And I was commanded to be of the believers.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (O Prophet!) Tell them: 'Men! If you are still in doubt concerning my religion, know that I do not serve those whom you serve beside Allah. I only serve Allah Who will cause (all of) you to die. I have been commanded to be one of those who believe,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Say:"O people! If you are in doubt about my religion - I will never worship those whom you worship besides Allah, rather, I will worship Allah, the One Who cause you to die. And I was commanded to be one of the believers.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Say (O Muhammad): O mankind! If ye are in doubt of my religion, then (know that) I worship not those whom ye worship instead of Allah, but I worship Allah Who causeth you to die, and I have been commanded to be of the believers.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Say, ‘O people! if you are in doubt about my religion, then [know that] I do not worship those whom you worship besides Allah. Rather, I worship only Allah, who causes you to die, and I have been commanded to be among the faithful,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Say: 'O people! If you are in doubt concerning my religion, I worship none of those you worship, other than Allah but I worship Allah, who will cause you to die, for I am commanded to be among the believers,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Say, [O Muhammad], "O people, if you are in doubt as to my religion - then I do not worship those which you worship besides Allah; but I worship Allah, who causes your death. And I have been commanded to be of the believers

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), say, "People, if you have doubt about my religion, know that I, certainly, do not worship the idols which you worship instead of God, but I worship God who causes you to die. I am commanded to believe (in His existence),

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Say: O people! if you are in doubt as to my religion, then (know that) I do not serve those whom you serve besides Allah but I do serve Allah, Who will cause you to die, and I am commanded that I should be of the believers.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qul ya ayyuha alnnasu in kuntum fee shakkin min deenee fala aAAbudu allatheena taAAbudoona min dooni Allahi walakin aAAbudu Allaha allathee yatawaffakum waomirtu an akoona mina almumineena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Say, "O people, if you are in doubt concerning my religion, then [know that] I do not worship those whom you worship instead of God, but rather I worship God who will cause you to die, for I am commanded to be one of the believers."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Say: "O ye men! If ye are in doubt as to my religion, (behold!) I worship not what ye worship, other than Allah! But I worship Allah - Who will take your souls (at death): I am commanded to be (in the ranks) of the Believers,

verses.text: وَ أَنْ‌ أَقِمْ‌ وَجْهَکَ‌ لِلدِّينِ‌ حَنِيفاً وَ لاَ تَکُونَنَ‌ مِنَ‌ الْمُشْرِکِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و [دستور یافته ام] که [حق گرایانه و بدون انحراف با همه وجود] به سوی [این] دین درست واستوار روی آور، و از مشرکان مباش.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و به دين حنيف روى آور و از مشركان مباش.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و [به من امر شده‌] كه با گرايش به حق به اين دين روى آور و هرگز از مشركان مباش

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و [به من دستور داده شده است‌] كه به دين حنيف روى آور، و زنهار از مشركان مباش.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و (خدا مرا امر کرده به) این که روی به جانب دین حنیف (اسلام و آیین پاک توحید) آور و هرگز هم آیین مشرکان مباش.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و (به من دستور داده شده است) این که به آئینی رو کن که خالی از هرگونه شرک و انحرافی است (و کاملاً موافق با فطرت است) و از زمره‌ی مشرکان مباش. [[«وَجْهَکَ»: روی خود را. توجّه خود را. «حَنیِفاً»: شخص مخلصی که کار و بار خود را به خدا واگذارد و از راستای دین به هیچ وجه منحرف نشود. راست و درست. خالص و بی غلّ و غشّ. این واژه می‌تواند حال فاعل فعل (أَقِمْ)، یا (وَجْهَ) به معنی توجّه، و یااین که (دین) باشد. یعنی توجّه مخلصانه، توجّه صادقانه، آئین مستقیم و بی‌شائبه.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و اینکه به سوی دین پاک روی آور و هرگز از مشرکان مباش‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و (به من دستور داده شده که:) روی خود را به آیینی متوجه ساز که از هر گونه شرک، خالی است؛ و از مشرکان مباش!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و آنکه راست کن روی خود را بسوی دین یکتاپرست و نباش البته از شرک‌ورزندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و اينكه روى خود را براى دين حنيف- حق‌گرا و خالص يعنى يكتاپرستى- فرادار و از مشركان مباش.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و اینکه چهره‌(ی فطرت)‌ات را برای دین - در حال رویگردانی از هر باطلی - بر‌آور و زنهار از مشرکان مباش.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And to set my face toward the way, as one upright, and not be one of those who associate others with God.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “And that ‘Set your face straight* for religion, apart from all others; and never be of those who ascribe partners (to Allah)’.” (* Your intention sincerely for religion.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: "Set thy face to the religion, a man of pure faith, and be thou not of the idolaters;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And that: keep thy countenance straight toward the religion, Upright; and by no means be of the associators.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "And (it is inspired to me): Direct your face (O Muhammad SAW) entirely towards the religion Hanifa (Islamic Monotheism, i.e. to worship none but Allah Alone), and never be one of the Mushrikun (those who ascribe partners to Allah, polytheists, idolaters, disbelievers in the Oneness of Allah, and those who worship others along with Allah).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And dedicate yourself to the true religion—a monotheist—and never be of the polytheists.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and to adhere exclusively and sincerely to the true faith, and not to be one of those who associate others with Allah in His divinity.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And (I was commanded), "Direct your face toward the Hanif (monotheism) religion, and not be one of the idolators."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And, (O Muhammad) set thy purpose resolutely for religion, as a man by nature upright, and be not of those who ascribe partners (to Allah).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and that: ‘‘Dedicate yourself to the religion, as a Hanif, and never be one of the polytheists.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and, set your face towards the religion, being of pure faith, and do not be among the idolaters.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And [commanded], 'Direct your face toward the religion, inclining to truth, and never be of those who associate others with Allah;

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: to have firm belief in the up-right religion and not to be an idolater

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And that you should keep your course towards the religion uprightly; and you should not be of the polytheists.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waan aqim wajhaka lilddeeni haneefan wala takoonanna mina almushrikeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: And set your face towards the [true] faith in all uprightness, and do not be one of those who ascribe partners to God;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "And further (thus): 'set thy face towards religion with true piety, and never in any wise be of the Unbelievers;

verses.text: وَ لاَ تَدْعُ‌ مِنْ‌ دُونِ‌ اللَّهِ‌ مَا لاَ يَنْفَعُکَ‌ وَ لاَ يَضُرُّکَ‌ فَإِنْ‌ فَعَلْتَ‌ فَإِنَّکَ‌ إِذاً مِنَ‌ الظَّالِمِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و به جای خدا چیزی را که سودی به تو نمی رساند و زیانی نمی زند، مَپَرست؛ که اگر بپرستی قطعاً از زیانکاران خواهی بود.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: به جاى اللّه، خدايانى را كه نه به تو سود مى‌رسانند و نه زيان، مخوان. اگر چنين كنى، از ستمكاران خواهى بود.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و جز خدا چيزى را كه سود و زيانى به تو نمى‌رساند مخوان، كه اگر چنين كنى، در آن صورت قطعا از ستمكارانى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و به جاى خدا، چيزى را كه سود و زيانى به تو نمى‌رساند، مخوان؛ كه اگر چنين كنى، در آن صورت قطعاً از جمله ستمكارانى.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و غیر از خدای یکتا هیچ یک از این خدایان باطل را که به حال تو نفع و ضرری ندارند به خدایی مخوان و گر نه از ستمکاران خواهی بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و به جای خدا کسی و چیزی را پرستش مکن و به فریاد مخوان که به تو نه سودی می‌رساند و نه زیانی. اگر چنین کنی (و دعا و عبادت خود را به جای آفریدگار متوجّه آفریدگان سازی) از ستمکاران و مشرکان خواهی شد. [[«لا تَدْعُ»: عبادت مکن. به فریاد مخوان. «الظَّالِمِینَ»: ستمگران. مراد کافران و مشرکان است (نگا: انعام / 82، لقمان / 13، بقره / 254).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و به جای خداوند چیزی را که نه سودی به تو می‌رساند و نه زیانی، مپرست، و اگر چنین کردی در آن صورت از ستمکاران [مشرک‌] خواهی بود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و جز خدا، چیزی را که نه سودی به تو می‌رساند و نه زیانی، مخوان! که اگر چنین کنی، از ستمکاران خواهی بود!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و نخوان جز خدا آنچه را نه سودی دهدت و نه گزندت رساند که اگر کنی هر آینه باشی در آن هنگام از ستمکاران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و بجز خدا آنچه تو را سود ندارد و زيان نرساند مخوان، كه اگر كنى- بخوانى- آنگاه از ستمكاران باشى.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و پس از خدا، چیزی را که سود و زیانی به تو نمی‌رساند مخوان. پس اگر چنان کنی، در آن صورت بی‌گمان از ستمکارانی.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And not to invoke any other than God, who can neither help nor hurt me; for if I do, I would surely be unjust.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “And other than Allah, do not worship that which cannot benefit you nor cause you harm; then if you do so, you would be of the unjust.” (* Some things like the sun, stars, trees are useful but they too are created by Allah. Their worship will not benefit – in fact it is harmful.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and do not call, apart from God, on that which neither profits nor hurts thee, for if thou dost, then thou wilt surely be of the evildoers.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And invoke not beside Allah that which can neither profit thee nor hurt thee; then if thou dost so, thou art forthwith of the wrong- doers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "And invoke not besides Allah, any that will neither profit you, nor hurt you, but if (in case) you did so, you shall certainly be one of the Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doers)."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And do not call, apart from God, on what neither benefits you nor harms you. If you do, you are then one of the wrongdoers.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Do not call upon any apart from Allah on those who have no power to benefit or hurt you. For if you call upon others than Allah you will be reckoned among the wrong-doers.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "And do not invoke besides Allah what will not benefit you nor harm you. For if you did, you would certainly be one of the wrongdoers."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And cry not, beside Allah, unto that which cannot profit thee nor hurt thee, for if thou didst so then wert thou of the wrong-doers.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Nor invoke besides Allah that which neither benefits you nor can do you any harm. For if you do so, then you will indeed be among the wrongdoers.’’ ’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Do not pray to, other than Allah, to anything that can neither help nor harm you, for if you do, you will become a harmdoer.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And do not invoke besides Allah that which neither benefits you nor harms you, for if you did, then indeed you would be of the wrongdoers.'"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: nor to seek help from anyone other than God [who can neither benefit nor harm me], lest I become of the unjust.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And do not call besides Allah on that which can neither benefit you nor harm you, for if you do then surely you will in that case be of the unjust.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wala tadAAu min dooni Allahi ma la yanfaAAuka wala yadurruka fain faAAalta fainnaka ithan mina alththalimeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and do not invoke besides God what can neither help nor harm you. If you do, you will be one of the wrongdoers.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "'Nor call on any, other than Allah;- Such will neither profit thee nor hurt thee: if thou dost, behold! thou shalt certainly be of those who do wrong.'"

verses.text: وَ إِنْ‌ يَمْسَسْکَ‌ اللَّهُ‌ بِضُرٍّ فَلاَ کَاشِفَ‌ لَهُ‌ إِلاَّ هُوَ وَ إِنْ‌ يُرِدْکَ‌ بِخَيْرٍ فَلاَ رَادَّ لِفَضْلِهِ‌ يُصِيبُ‌ بِهِ‌ مَنْ‌ يَشَاءُ مِنْ‌ عِبَادِهِ‌ وَ هُوَ الْغَفُورُ الرَّحِيمُ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و اگر خدا گزند و آسیبی به تو رساند، آن را جز او برطرف کننده ای نیست، و اگر برای تو خیری خواهد فضل و احسانش را دفع کننده ای نیست؛ خیرش را به هر کس از بندگانش بخواهد می رساند و او بسیار آمرزنده و مهربان است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و اگر خدا به تو زيانى برساند، جز او كس دفع آن نتواند كرد. و اگر براى تو خيرى بخواهد، هيچ كس فضل او را باز نتواند داشت. فضل خود را به هر كس از بندگانش كه بخواهد مى‌رساند و او آمرزنده و مهربان است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اگر خدا زيانى به تو برساند، هيچ كس جز او برطرف كننده‌ى آن نيست، و اگر براى تو خيرى بخواهد، كرم او را هيچ بازدارنده‌اى نخواهد بود. آن را به هر كس از بندگانش كه بخواهد مى‌رساند، و او آمرزنده‌ى مهربان است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اگر خدا به تو زيانى برساند، آن را برطرف‌كننده‌اى جز او نيست، و اگر براى تو خيرى بخواهد، بخشش او را ردكننده‌اى نيست. آن را به هر كس از بندگانش كه بخواهد مى‌رساند، و او آمرزنده مهربان است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و اگر خدا بر تو ضرری خواهد هیچ کس جز او دفع آن ضرر نتواند، و اگر خیر و رحمتی خواهد باز احدی منع فضل او نتواند، که فضل و رحمت خود را به هر کس از بندگان بخواهد البته می‌رساند و اوست خدای بسیار آمرزنده و مهربان.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: اگر خداوند زیانی به تو برساند، هیچ کس جز او نمی‌تواند آن را برطرف گرداند، و اگر بخواهد خیری به تو برساند، هیچ کس نمی‌تواند فضل و لطف او را از تو برگرداند. خداوند فضل و لطف خود را شامل هرکس از بندگانش که بخواهد می‌کند (و کسی نمی‌تواند مانع آن گردد) و او دارای مغفرت و مهر فراوان است. [[«کَاشِفَ»: برطرف کننده. «رَآدَّ»: برگرداننده. مانع.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و اگر خداوند بخواهد بلایی به تو برساند، بازدارنده‌ای جز خود او برای آن وجود ندارد، و اگر خیری برایت بخواهد، فضل او بازدارنده‌ای ندارد، که آن را به هرکس از بندگانش که بخواهد می‌رساند، و او آمرزگار مهربان است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و اگر خداوند، (برای امتحان یا کیفر گناه،) زیانی به تو رساند، هیچ کس جز او آن را برطرف نمی‌سازد؛ و اگر اراده خیری برای تو کند، هیچ کس مانع فضل او نخواهد شد! آنرا به هر کس از بندگانش بخواهد می‌رساند؛ و او غفور و رحیم است!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و اگر برساندت خدا به رنجی نیست گشاینده برای آن جز او و اگر اراده کند تو را به خیری نباشد برگرداننده برای فضلش رساندش به هر که خواهد از بندگان خود و او است آمرزنده مهربان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و اگر خدا گزندى به تو رساند، آن را جز او هيچ بازبرنده‌اى نيست و اگر براى تو نيكى بخواهد، پس فضل او را هيچ بازگرداننده‌اى نيست، آن را به هر كس از بندگان خود بخواهد مى‌رساند، و اوست آمرزگار و مهربان.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و اگر خدا به تو زیانی رساند هیچ رهاننده‌ای (از این زیان) جز او نیست و اگر برای تو خیری بخواهد بخشش او را هیچ ردّ کننده‌ای نیست. آن را به هر کس از بندگانش بخواهد می‌رساند و تنها او بسی پوشنده‌ی رحمتگر بر ویژگان است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Should God bring you harm there is none but He who could deliver you from it, and if He wish you good there is none who could take away His blessings: He showers them on those of His creatures as He please, and He is forgiving and kind."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “And if Allah afflicts you with some suffering, there is none who can remove it except Him; and if He wills good for you, there is none who can repel His munificence; He bestows it upon whomever He wills from among His bondmen; He is the Oft Forgiving, the Most Merciful.” (* Help, cure, monetary aid etc., whatever benefit derived from any source, reaches us because Allah has given the source this power and is actually through the grace and mercy of Allah.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And if God visits thee with affliction, none can remove it but He; and if He desires any good for thee, none can repel His bounty; He causes it to fall upon whomsoever He will of His servants." He is the All-forgiving, the All-compassionate.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And if Allah toucheth thee with hurt there is no remover thereof but he, and if He intendeth any good there is no averter of His grace. He letteth it befall on whomsoever of His bondmen He will; and He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And if Allah touches you with hurt, there is none who can remove it but He; and if He intends any good for you, there is none who can repel His Favour which He causes it to reach whomsoever of His slaves He will. And He is the Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: If God afflicts you with harm, none can remove it except He. And if He wants good for you, none can repel His grace. He makes it reach whomever He wills of His servants. He is the Forgiver, the Merciful.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: If Allah afflicts you with any hardship, none other than He can remove it; and if He wills any good for you, none can avert His bounty. He bestows good upon whomsoever of His servants He wills. He is AllForgiving, All-Merciful.'

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And if Allah touches you with harm, there is none who can lift it but He. And if He intends good for you, then none can repel His favor which He causes to reach whom He wills among His servants. And He is the Pardoning, the Merciful.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: If Allah afflicteth thee with some hurt, there is none who can remove it save Him; and if He desireth good for thee, there is none who can repel His bounty. He striketh with it whom He will of his bondmen. He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Should Allah visit you with some distress, there is no one to remove it except Him; and should He desire any good for you, none can stand in the way of His grace: He grants it to whomever He wishes of His servants, and He is the All-forgiving, the All-merciful.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: If Allah touches you an affliction none can remove it except He; and if He wills any good for you, none can repel His Bounty. He causes it to fall upon whosoever of His worshippers that He will. He is the Forgiving, the Most Merciful.'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And if Allah should touch you with adversity, there is no remover of it except Him; and if He intends for you good, then there is no repeller of His bounty. He causes it to reach whom He wills of His servants. And He is the Forgiving, the Merciful

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), if God afflicts you with hardship, no one besides Him can save you. If God grants you a favor, no one can prevent you from receiving His favors. God bestows His favors upon whichever of His servants He wants. God is All-forgiving and All-merciful.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And if Allah should afflict you with harm, then there is none to remove it but He; and if He intends good to you there is none to repel His grace; He brings it to whom He pleases of His servants; and He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wain yamsaska Allahu bidurrin fala kashifa lahu illa huwa wain yuridka bikhayrin fala radda lifadlihi yuseebu bihi man yashao min AAibadihi wahuwa alghafooru alrraheemu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: If God inflicts harm on you, no one can remove it but He, and if He intends good for you, no one can withhold His bounty; He grants His bounty to any of His servants whom He will. He is the Most Forgiving, and the Most Merciful.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: If Allah do touch thee with hurt, there is none can remove it but He: if He do design some benefit for thee, there is none can keep back His favour: He causeth it to reach whomsoever of His servants He pleaseth. And He is the Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

verses.text: قُلْ‌ يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ‌ قَدْ جَاءَکُمُ‌ الْحَقُ‌ مِنْ‌ رَبِّکُمْ‌ فَمَنِ‌ اهْتَدَى‌ فَإِنَّمَا يَهْتَدِي‌ لِنَفْسِهِ‌ وَ مَنْ‌ ضَلَ‌ فَإِنَّمَا يَضِلُ‌ عَلَيْهَا وَ مَا أَنَا عَلَيْکُمْ‌ بِوَکِيلٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بگو: ای مردم! یقیناً حق از سوی پروردگارتان برای شما آمد؛ پس هر که هدایت یابد، فقط به سود خود هدایت می یابد و هر که گمراه گردد، فقط به زیان خود گمراه می شود، و من نگهبان شما نیستم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بگو: اى مردم، پيام راستين از جانب پروردگارتان برايتان فرا رسيد. پس هر كس كه به راه راست هدايت يابد، هدايت به سود اوست. و هر كه گمراه گردد، به زيان خويش به گمراهى افتاده است. و من عهده‌دار شما نيستم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بگو: اى مردم! پيام حق از جانب پروردگارتان براى شما آمده است. پس هر كه هدايت پذيرد تنها به سود خويش هدايت مى‌شود و هر كه گمراه شود فقط به زيان خود گمراه مى‌گردد، و من بر شما نگهبان نيستم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بگو: «اى مردم، حق از جانب پروردگارتان براى شما آمده است. پس هر كه هدايت يابد به سود خويش هدايت مى‌يابد، و هر كه گمراه گردد به زيان خود گمراه مى‌شود، و من بر شما نگهبان نيستم.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بگو: ای مردم به حقیقت (کتاب و رسول) حق از جانب خدایتان برای شما آمد، پس هر کس هدایت یافت نفعش بر خود اوست و هر کس به راه گمراهی شتافت زیانش بر خود اوست و من نگهبان شما (از مؤاخذه خدا) نیستم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بگو: ای مردمان (سراسر جهان، اعم از همعصران و آیندگان)، از سوی پروردگارتان، حق (که کتاب راستین قرآن است، توسّط پیغمبر صادق آخرالزمان) به سویتان آمده است. هرکس که (با ایمان آوردن به شریعت خدا) راهیاب گردد، بیگمان به سود خود راهیاب می‌شود (و نفع ایمان عائد خودش می‌گردد) و هرکس که (با گردن نهادن به کفر و پیروی از وسوسه‌های شیطان) گمراه و سرگشته شود، به زیان خود گمراه و سرگشته می‌شود (و زیان کفر و بی‌دینی گریبانگیر خودش می‌گردد. کار من تنها تبلیغ فرموده‌های خدا است) و من مأمور (مراقبت از اعمال، و مسؤول نظارت) بر (افعال) شما نیستم (و قدرت آن را ندارم که شما را از کفر باز دارم و به پذیرش ایمان وادارم). [[«الْحَقُّ»: قرآن. دین اسلام (نگا: بقره / 119، یونس / 94). «وَکِیلٍ»: حافظ. مراقب. مسؤول (نگا: انعام / 66، 102، 107).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بگو ای مردم حق از سوی پروردگارتان بر شما نازل شده است، پس هر کس که رهیاب شود، همانا به سود خویش رهیاب شده است، و هرکس بیراه رود، همانا به زیان خویش بیراه رفته است، و من نگهبان شما نیستم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بگو: «ای مردم! حق از طرف پروردگارتان به سراغ شما آمده؛ هر کس (در پرتو آن) هدایت یابد، برای خود هدایت شده؛ و هر کس گمراه گردد، به زیان خود گمراه می‌گردد؛ و من مأمور (به اجبار) شما نیستم!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بگو ای مردم همانا بیامد شما را حقّ از پروردگار شما پس هر که هدایت شود جز این نیست که هدایت شود برای خویشتن و هر که گمراه شود گمراه نشود مگر بر خویش و نیستم من بر شما وکیل‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بگو: اى مردم، اينك شما را حقّ- قرآن يا دين حقّ- از سوى پروردگارتان آمد، پس هر كه راه يابد جز اين نيست كه به سود خويشتن راه مى‌يابد و هر كه گمراه شود همانا به زيان خويش گمراه مى‌شود، و من بر شما نگاهبان نيستم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بگو: «هان ای مردمان! بی‌گمان تمامی حق از (جانب) پروردگارتان برایتان آمده است. پس هر کس هدایت یابد تنها به سود خویش هدایت می‌یابد و هر کس گمراه گردد، تنها به زیان خود گمراه می‌گردد و من بر (سر و سامان)تان کارسازی نیستم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Say: "O men, the truth has come to you from your Lord, so he who follows the right path does so for himself, and he who goes astray errs against himself, and I am not a guardian over you.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Say, “O people! The truth* has come to you from your Lord; so whoever came to guidance, has come to guidance for his own benefit; and whoever strayed, has strayed for his own harm; and I am not a trustee over you.” (* Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him, or Islam or the Qur’an.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Say: 'O men, the truth has come to you from your Lord. Whosoever is guided is guided only to his own gain, and whosoever goes astray, it is only to his own loss. I am not a guardian over you.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Say thou: O mankind! the truth hath surely come unto you from your Lord: whosoever then is guided, is guided only for himself, and whosoever strayeth, strayeth only against himself; and am not over you a trustee.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: . Say: "O you mankind! Now truth (i.e. the Quran and Prophet Muhammad SAW), has come to you from your Lord. So whosoever receives guidance, he does so for the good of his own self, and whosoever goes astray, he does so to his own loss, and I am not (set) over you as a Wakil (disposer of affairs to oblige you for guidance)."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Say, “O people, the truth has come to you from your Lord. Whoever accepts guidance is guided for his own soul; and whoever strays only strays to its detriment. I am not a guardian over you.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Tell them (O Muhammad): 'Men! Truth has come to you from your Lord. Whosoever, then, follows the true guidance does so for his own good; and whosoever strays, his straying will be to his own hurt. I am no custodian over you.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Say: "O people! Now the truth has come to you from your Lord. So whoever receives guidance, he does so for the good of himself. And whoever goes astray, he does so at his own loss. And I am not set over you as a guardian.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Say: O mankind! Now hath the Truth from your Lord come unto you. So whosoever is guided, is guided only for (the good of) his soul, and whosoever erreth erreth only against it. And I am not a warder over you.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Say, ‘O mankind! The truth has already come to you from your Lord. Whoever is guided, is guided only for [the good of] his own soul, and whoever goes astray, goes astray only to its detriment, and it is not my business to watch over you.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Say: 'O people! The truth has come to you from your Lord. Whosoever is guided is guided only for himself, and whosoever goes astray, he is astray for himself. I am not a guardian over you'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Say, "O mankind, the truth has come to you from your Lord, so whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] his soul, and whoever goes astray only goes astray [in violation] against it. And I am not over you a manager."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), say, "People, truth has certainly come to you from your Lord. One who seeks guidance does so for his own good and One who goes astray will find himself lost. I am not your keeper".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Say: O people! indeed there has come to you the truth from your Lord, therefore whoever goes aright, he goes aright only for the good of his own soul, and whoever goes astray, he goes astray only to the detriment of it, and I am not a custodian over you.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qul ya ayyuha alnnasu qad jaakumu alhaqqu min rabbikum famani ihtada fainnama yahtadee linafsihi waman dalla fainnama yadillu AAalayha wama ana AAalaykum biwakeelin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Say, "Mankind, Truth has come to you from your Lord! Anyone who accepts guidance is guided only for his own sake; and he who goes astray does so at his own peril. I am not appointed as your keeper."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Say: "O ye men! Now Truth hath reached you from your Lord! those who receive guidance, do so for the good of their own souls; those who stray, do so to their own loss: and I am not (set) over you to arrange your affairs."

verses.text: وَ اتَّبِعْ‌ مَا يُوحَى‌ إِلَيْکَ‌ وَ اصْبِرْ حَتَّى‌ يَحْکُمَ‌ اللَّهُ‌ وَ هُوَ خَيْرُ الْحَاکِمِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و از آنچه به سویت وحی می شود، پیروی کن و [در برابر پیش آمدها و تکذیب منکران] شکیبا باش تا خدا [میان تو و مخالفانت] داوری کند؛ و او بهترین داوران است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چيزى را كه به تو وحى مى‌شود پيروى كن و صبر كن تا خدا داورى كند كه او بهترين داوران است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و از آنچه بر تو وحى مى‌شود پيروى كن و صبور باش تا خدا داورى كند، و او بهترين داوران است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و از آنچه بر تو وحى مى‌شود پيروى كن و شكيبا باش تا خدا [ميان تو و آنان‌] داورى كند، و او بهترين داوران است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و تو خود از وحی خدای که بر تو می‌رسد پیروی کن و راه صبر پیش گیر تا وقتی که خدا (میان تو و مخالفانت) حکم کند و او بهترین حکمفرمایان عالم است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: از آنچه بر تو وحی می‌شود، پیروی کن و شکیبا باش (و در برابر اذیّت و آزاری که در راه تبلیغ رسالت آسمانی به تو می‌رسد، استقامت کن) تا خداوند (میان تو و دیگران) داوری می‌کند (و فرمان خود را صادر می‌نماید) و او بهترین داوران است. [[«إِتَّبِعْ»: پیروی کن. «الْحَاکِمِینَ»: داوران. قضات (نگا: اعراف / 87).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و از آنچه بر تو وحی می‌شود پیروی کن و شکیبا باش، تا خداوند حکم خویش به میان آورد، و او بهترین داوران است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و از آنچه بر تو وحی می‌شود پیروی کن، و شکیبا باش (و استقامت نما)، تا خداوند فرمان (پیروزی) را صادر کند؛ و او بهترین حاکمان است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و پیروی کن آنچه را وحی می‌شود بسوی تو و صبر کن تا حکم کند خدا و او است بهترین حکم‌کنندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و آنچه را كه به تو وحى مى‌شود پيروى كن، و شكيبايى كن تا خداى داورى كند و او بهترين داوران است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و آنچه را فراسوی تو وحی می‌شود پیروی کن و شکیبایی نمای، تا خدا (میان تو و آنان) حکم کند. و او بهترین حاکمان است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Follow what is revealed to you, and persist until God pronounce His judgement; for He is the best of all judges."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him) follow what is divinely revealed to you, and have patience till Allah gives His command; and He is the Best of Rulers.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And follow thou what is revealed to thee; and be thou patient until God shall judge; and He is the best of judges.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And follow thou whatsoever is revealed unto thee, and endure until Allah judgeth, and He is the Best of judges.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And (O Muhammad SAW), follow the inspiration sent unto you, and be patient till Allah gives judgement. And He is the Best of judges.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And follow what is revealed to you, and be patient until God issues His judgment, for He is the Best of judges.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And follow, (O Prophet!), whatever is revealed to you, and remain patient until Allah brings forth His judgement. He is the best of those who judge.'

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And follow what is revealed to you, and be patient until Allah gives judgment. And He is the best of the judges.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And (O Muhammad) follow that which is inspired in thee, and forbear until Allah give judgment. And He is the Best of Judges.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And follow that which is revealed to you, and be patient until Allah issues [His] judgement, and He is the best of judges.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Follow what is revealed to you, and be patient till Allah shall judge, and He is the Best of judges.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And follow what is revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and be patient until Allah will judge. And He is the best of judges.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), follow what is revealed to you and have patience until God issues His Judgment; He is the best Judge.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And follow what is revealed to you and be patient till Allah should give judgment, and He is the best of the judges.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: WaittabiAA ma yooha ilayka waisbir hatta yahkuma Allahu wahuwa khayru alhakimeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Follow what is revealed to you, [O Prophet], and be steadfast until God gives His judgement. He is the Best of Judges.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Follow thou the inspiration sent unto thee, and be patient and constant, till Allah do decide: for He is the best to decide.
